spotText: STUTTGART, Germany — Scientists have developed a pangolin-inspired robot that rolls around inside your body. Researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems created the magnetically controlled soft medical bot with a unique, flexible structure inspired by the body of the scaly mammals.

Sadly, slowing down physically often goes hand in hand with slowing down socially. A British study found that more than one in five (22%) seniors only talk to three people over the span of an entire week. Even more alarming, thousands will go a week without talking to anyone face-to-face. With that in mind, it’s no surprise that 38 percent of seniors admitted to feeling lonely at times. More than half (54%) of respondents agreed that even a short conversation with a neighbor or acquaintance would greatly improve their day.

Speaking of fast-food menu items, a recent study found that fast food menus are even more unhealthy now than they were 30 years ago. It’s hard to believe that despite an obvious attempt by fast food chains to increase the number of healthy menu options, fast food menus are even more unhealthy than years ago. The research team found that fast-food entrees, sides, and desserts have all significantly increased in total calories and sodium over the study period. The portion sizes of fast-food entrees and desserts have also grown since the 1980s, and the variety of entree, side, and dessert options increased by 226 percent — or about 23 items per year. Among those new menu options are fast-food chicken sandwiches.

The appeal of classic rock runs deep in many listeners. Powerful rock musicians like Janis Joplin and Jim Morrison brought guitar music to the youth of America and the world. In a time that was filled with prolific rockers, Jimi Hendrix, with his obvious talent and unrelenting stage presence, set the tone for an era of music. The best Jimi Hendrix songs are loaded with rattling guitar riffs and explosive rhythm, true to the artist’s style.

se deben tomar precauciones cuando las cosas se ponen demasiado calurosas, al igual que lo harías contigo mismo. Toma el sueño, por ejemplo. El verano de 2022 fue uno de los más calurosos hasta la fecha. Incluso las noches de verano con brisa hicieron poco para escapar del calor, ya que el cambio climático calienta el planeta. Además de hacer que las facturas del aire acondicionado se disparen, las noches calurosas de verano, como las de hace unos meses, pueden afectarte de más de una manera. Investigadores de Japón han descubierto que las altas temperaturas nocturnas pueden afectar la calidad de tu sueño y aumentar el riesgo de trastornos del sueño. El equipo encuestó a 1.200 residentes que viven en Nagoya, Japón. Nagoya es una ciudad en el centro de Japón que se sabe que tiene uno de los mayores aumentos de temperatura entre las tres principales ciudades del país.

Stress makes us feel mentally exhausted, but physically our body also experiences that same exhaustion. Recent research reveals that stress can age your body down to the genetic level, and even put you at higher risk of cognitive decline and lead to conditions like dementia.

Coleccionar tarjetas deportivas se trata de más que simplemente guardar una tarjeta con fines de exhibición y estéticos. Hoy en día, coleccionar tarjetas deportivas es más como una inversión. El valor de diversas tarjetas sube y baja con la demanda y circulación. Los coleccionistas deben ser inversionistas astutos si quieren que sus compras sean rentables a largo plazo. Sin embargo, una encuesta reciente sugiere que solo uno de cada tres estadounidenses tiene confianza en sus habilidades de inversión. Una encuesta realizada a 2.000 estadounidenses encontró que solo el 45 por ciento de los encuestados entendía cómo funciona la inflación, mientras que menos del 30 por ciento de los encuestados se sentían seguros en su conocimiento de acciones y bonos. Quizás algunos se sentirían más seguros en su capacidad para invertir en tarjetas de fútbol.

Why do people go bald? A recent study, conducted by the University of Utah, comparing genetic codes of 62 different animals revealed that humans still have all the genes necessary to sport a full coat of body hair, but evolution appears to have “disabled” those specific genes. Interestingly, the study notes that nature has used the very same evolutionary strategy in at least nine other mammals residing on various branches of the evolutionary tree. The ancestors of rhinos, naked mole rats, dolphins, and other hairless mammals all appear to have followed the same path to deactivate a common set of genes, resulting in the loss of hair and fur.

When I was in medical school, I sold my blood – sort of – to supplement my student loans. It’s illegal to sell blood, organs, and tissues in the United States, but I was being paid to participate in research projects. For one study I was hospitalized overnight. There was a tube in a vein in my arm from which blood was drawn every 30 minutes. They ran the tube through the wall to the next room, so they wouldn’t disturb my sleep during the blood draw. I made $50. There were plenty of other studies. I hit the jackpot trying out a new soap – $175. I’m sure the pay rates have increased significantly.

EDM is popular today not only at music festivals, but also as part of workout mixes, and general pump-you-up playlists. Modern artists mix electronic sound, digital beats, and celebrity featured artists like Sia or The Black Eyed Peas. EDM is music with a pulse, and for fans of the genre, it is irreplaceable. In previous decades this music might have been called techno, trance, or perhaps electronica. Now, EDM is mainstream pop and dance music that a person might stumble across while shopping at the supermarket or in the drive-thru. What has accounted for this change in the mainstream appeal of EDM? Perhaps it is the faster-paced rhythm or the pounding enhanced bass, but either way EDM seems to have taken a place in the musical mainstream of America.

A guard dog on the other hand deters and protects. Dog ownership improves security on a larger scale as well: Neighborhoods with more dogs experience less crime — including murder and assault, researchers from the Ohio State University found. Their study results suggest that more people walking their dogs puts more “eyes on the street,” which discourages criminals from committing both violent and non-violent crimes.

El cáncer es una enfermedad que afecta a millones de personas en todo el mundo, y aunque la medicina moderna ha avanzado mucho en su tratamiento y cura, la prevención siempre es mejor que la cura. Lo que comes puede tener un impacto definitivo en tu salud. Mientras que consumir alimentos que contienen conservantes o químicos cancerígenos puede causar cáncer, existen otros alimentos que contienen compuestos naturales que pueden ayudar a prevenirlo. Los mejores alimentos anticancerígenos contienen poderosos antioxidantes, vitaminas y nutrientes clave para mantener una salud óptima a largo plazo.

Driving independently is a massive responsibility, and despite all the practice, nothing can replace the great teacher of experience. Still, it’s important to understand and prepare teenagers for the risks and dangers of driving. Studies show that teenagers are eight times more likely to crash in the first months after getting their driver’s license. And it’s more than urban legend that teens are attached to their phones, as research has found that teenage drivers hold their phones for 30% of their drives, and speed 40% of the time.

cualquier espectáculo, es posible que te decepcione saber que, probablemente, no se compara con una macronova. ¿Qué es eso? Un nuevo tipo de explosión estelar. Los investigadores observaron este fenómeno en la superficie de tres enanas blancas mientras se alimentaban de hidrógeno y otros materiales de sus estrellas compañeras. Las enanas blancas son los restos de estrellas muertas que han agotado todo su combustible. Y el equipo descubrió este nuevo hallazgo cuando vieron un breve y brillante destello de luz mientras analizaban los datos del Satélite de Encuentro de Exoplanetas en Tránsito (TESS, por sus siglas en inglés) de la NASA. El investigador Simone Scaringi dijo: “Hemos descubierto e identificado por primera vez lo que estamos llamando una macronova”. También menciona que “este fenómeno desafía nuestra comprensión de cómo ocurren las explosiones termonucleares en las estrellas. Pensábamos que lo sabíamos, pero este descubrimiento propone una forma totalmente nueva de lograrlas”.

The inability to replicate is not necessarily a bad thing. These cells have suffered damage to their DNA – for example, skin cells damaged by the sun’s rays – so stopping replication stops the damage from spreading.

As people get older, their gut microbiome (the community of microbes living in the digestive tract) changes, and their cognitive abilities (like thinking and remembering) often decrease. This study looked at the gut microbiomes of middle-aged and older adults, some of whom had mild cognitive impairment (MCI) – which means they had minor problems with things like memory or decision-making – and compared them with adults of the same age who didn’t have any brain-related health problems. Probiotics are like “good” bacteria that can help with digestion and overall health. In this study, the scientists wanted to know if these probiotics could also improve mental health and protect the brain as it ages.

Many Americans love a day of shopping, but it turns out that faith in the American dream can actually lead to less impulsive shopping. The study out of the University at Buffalo and Johns Hopkins University, was published in the Journal of Marketing Research. A co-author of the study says, “When materialistic people believe they have the power to change their financial circumstances, they’re more likely to save money and focus on long-term success, rather than the short-term pleasure of having the latest technology or products.” To conduct this study, researchers split up a mix of college students and adult consumers into two groups. One group was shown news stories promoting economic mobility while the other was shown the opposite. They ran this study four times total. Researchers found that if people believed that they couldn’t change their economic status, they had less control over impulse spending.

In a survey of 500 people, study author Chun-Chu “Bamboo” Chen from Washington State University examined the impact of traveling on long-term emotional wellness. The results reveal people who regularly take trips of at least 75 miles from their home are about seven percent happier than respondents who rarely travel. “While things like work, family life and friends play a bigger role in overall reports of well-being, the accumulation of travel experiences does appear to have a small yet noticeable effect on self-reported life satisfaction,” Chen says in a university release. “It really illustrates the importance of being able to get out of your routine and experience new things.”

Hay algunas cosas que debes saber sobre la cerveza ácida si no estás familiarizado con ella. Si bien el sabor de la cerveza ácida puede parecer exótico para los bebedores de cerveza estadounidenses, el estilo en realidad se remonta a los primeros días de la elaboración de cerveza cuando todas las cervezas eran no pasteurizadas y estaban cargadas de bacterias. Es la presencia de bacterias como Lactobacillus y Pediococcus lo que le da a la cerveza ácida su distintivo sabor agrio. A diferencia de las cervezas convencionales, que utilizan una sola cepa de levadura para producir un sabor consistente, las cervezas ácidas utilizan una variedad de levaduras salvajes y bacterias que pueden dar como resultado un perfil de sabor único en cada lote. This type of respiration describes the set of metabolic reactions that need oxygen in order to happen within the mitochondria in order to successfully produce adenosine triphosphate (ATP).

shopping in person. A new study shows that you are more likely to splurge on unnecessary items when shopping on a touchscreen as opposed to shopping on a desktop. Researchers at the University of British Columbia’s Okanagan Campus recruited nearly 300 students at the school to take part in three different experiments that examined their online purchasing habits. “The playful and fun nature of the touchscreen enhances consumers’ favor of hedonic products; while the logical and functional nature of a desktop endorses the consumers’ preference for utilitarian products,” Zhu explains in a university news release. Zhu claims that her findings found that desktop users were more likely to use rational thinking when it came to spending money online, while touchscreen products saw students opening their wallets more for products that weren’t so rational — what she refers to as “experiential” thinking. Maybe just keep it to the actual mall visits.

The start for late-night talk show hosts was no easy path, however. In 1950, NBC aired its first ever late-night comedy series titled “Broadway Open House” but struggled to find a host for its first few weeks on air, opting instead to have guests such as Jerry Lewis and Dean Martin take on the task. Jerry Lester eventually landed the role of sole host of the show till its finale. Though not a huge success, this series would serve as the blueprint for creating “The Tonight Show” four years later.

BOSTON — New research suggests eyes may hold the key to early diagnosis of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) and brain injuries. Scientists at Boston Medical Center have discovered a correlation between biomarkers in the vitreous humor of the eye and confirmed cases of Alzheimer’s disease and Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy (CTE). The study indicates these biomarkers could serve as early indicators of neurodegenerative diseases.

Sin embargo, el viaje desde el baloncesto juvenil hasta la NBA es largo y tumultuoso, lleno de altibajos, sin intención de juego de palabras. El equipo descubrió que los niños que practican deportes multidireccionales como el baloncesto tienen huesos un 10 a 20 por ciento más fuertes que los niños que se enfocan solo en correr. Eso ciertamente justifica mantener a tus hijos en una variedad de deportes, especialmente el baloncesto. Quién sabe, podrías tener al próximo gran centro de la NBA entre tus manos.

De “All Shook Up” à “Uptown Girl” en passant par “Uptown Funk”, la musique a connu de nombreux changements au fil des décennies. Pas seulement stylistiquement, cependant. Selon de nouvelles recherches, les paroles des chansons pop sont devenues plus sombres et plus audacieuses au fil du temps. Des chercheurs de l’Université Lawrence Technological ont étudié les paroles des chansons populaires des années 1950 à 2016. À l’aide d’analyses quantitatives, les scientifiques ont repéré les tendances des sentiments exprimés dans les paroles des chansons couvrant sept décennies. Dans leurs résultats, les scientifiques de l’université et co-auteurs Kathleen Napier et Lior Shamir ont écrit que leurs recherches montrent un “changement clair et statistiquement significatif dans les sentiments exprimés à travers les paroles de la musique populaire, généralement vers une tonalité plus négative”.

Scientists at Martin Luther University Halle-Wittenberg (MLU) say that while this practice is technically truthful and well-intentioned by manufacturers, consumers can’t help but get the wrong idea about what they’re eating and drinking.

Les naines blanches sont les restes d’étoiles mortes ayant épuisé tout leur carburant. Et l’équipe a fait cette nouvelle découverte lorsqu’elle a observé une brève et intense lueur en analysant les données du satellite TESS (Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite) de la NASA. Le chercheur Simone Scaringi a déclaré : “Nous avons découvert et identifié pour la première fois ce que nous appelons une macronova”. Il mentionne également que “le phénomène remet en question notre compréhension de la manière dont les explosions thermonucléaires se produisent dans les étoiles. Nous pensions le savoir, mais cette découverte propose une toute nouvelle façon de les déclencher”.

Circular RNAs have the ability to bind to DNA at various locations in different cells. By binding to specific sites on DNA, they initiate changes that result in DNA breakage, which the cell must repair to survive. However, this repair process is not always flawless and can lead to small mutations, akin to misspelled words in a book, or more severe cases, significant and devastating mutations.

Looking at the giant region as different parts of a cat’s face is actually helping astronomers observe different phenomena. Under the “cat’s nose” is the center of the bright part of the nebula. This area contains a special bunch of young stars called Dolidze 25. These stars help create strong radiation. The radiation emitted from the stars is powerful enough to ionize the hydrogen gas in the clouds giving the nebula its distinctive orange and red color. Clouds like this create the optimal environments for new stars to live and grow.

Before you hit one of these fabulous malls, try to hold back on that extra cup of Joe. Coffee and credit cards may be a financial planner’s worst nightmare, according to researchers from the University of South Florida. Scientists report shoppers who sip on a complimentary cup of coffee before shopping ended up spending 50 percent more money and buying 30 percent more items than their non-caffeinated counterparts. “Caffeine, as a powerful stimulant, releases dopamine in the brain, which excites the mind and the body. This leads to a higher energetic state, which in turn enhances impulsivity and decreases self-control,” says lead study author Dipayan Biswas, the Frank Harvey Endowed Professor of Marketing at USF, in a university release. “As a result, caffeine intake leads to shopping impulsivity in terms of a higher number of items purchased and greater spending.”

Sin embargo, el Dr. Ziyad Al-Aly, autor de este último estudio realizado en la Universidad de Washington en St. Louis, dice que “el inicio de problemas renales agudos no es una señal de advertencia confiable para que los médicos detecten un deterioro en la función renal en pacientes que toman inhibidores de la bomba de protones”. El estudio indica que “los problemas renales pueden desarrollarse en silencio y gradualmente con el tiempo, erosionando la función renal y conduciendo a daños a largo plazo, e incluso a insuficiencia renal”, según el Dr. Al-Aly. maladie neurodégénérative qui détruit les cellules nerveuses et limite finalement la fonctionnalité des muscles. Dans l’étude, les chercheurs ont voulu étudier la SLA en utilisant des vers C. elegans – qui servent de modèle animal de déclin neuronal. Ce ne sont peut-être que des vers, mais ils partagent 60 % de leur patrimoine génétique avec les humains. Les scientifiques les ont génétiquement modifiés pour avoir des gènes associés à la SLA. Pour tester les effets des différents probiotiques, Labarre a testé 13 souches différentes et trois combinaisons différentes. L’une appelée HA-114 a démontré quelque chose d’unique. Le mécanisme d’action était neuroprotecteur, réduisant les troubles moteurs chez les modèles de vers atteints à la fois de la SLA et de la maladie de Huntington, une autre maladie neurodégénérative. Étonnamment, les chercheurs ont constaté que l’ajout de probiotiques à l’alimentation de notre modèle animal supprime la progression de la dégénérescence des motoneurones.

avoir analysé les critiques disponibles sur Rotten Tomatoes, les chercheurs décrivent une mesure de “cohérence thématique” permettant de mesurer le degré de recoupement entre le contenu des critiques des utilisateurs et des critiques. Selon les auteurs de l’étude, cette relation semble avoir un impact sur les ventes de films. Si les critiques et les utilisateurs discutent généralement des mêmes aspects d’un film donné dans leurs critiques, il sera plus mémorable et augmentera la probabilité que les gens aillent voir le film. Des critiques similaires soutiennent les films moyens. De manière intéressante, les résultats suggèrent que cette association est plus forte pour les films ayant généralement des notes de critiques médiocres que pour ceux dont les notes varient considérablement. Elle est également plus solide lorsque les notes des critiques reflètent celles des utilisateurs. Par exemple, lorsque les deux mentionnent des aspects tels que l’intrigue [le rebondissement] ou la performance des acteurs.

Le manque de sommeil, le stress, le vieillissement et même les facteurs environnementaux peuvent faire perdre à notre peau son éclat au fil du temps. Vous savez probablement déjà que le tabagisme passif entraîne des problèmes de santé. Mais, une étude de l’Université de Californie-Riverside révèle que l’exposition aiguë à la fumée de tabac persistante (THS) peut entraîner des maladies de la peau. La fumée persistante fait référence aux polluants résiduels de la fumée de tabac qui persistent sur les surfaces intérieures telles que les canapés ou les tables, ainsi que dans la poussière, longtemps après que la cigarette ait été fumée. Selon les conclusions de l’équipe de l’UC Riverside, l’exposition aiguë à la fumée de tabac persistante semble entraîner l’élévation de biomarqueurs associés au développement de diverses maladies de la peau, notamment la dermatite de contact et le psoriasis.

Moreover, circular RNAs can also alter the physical location of the broken DNA within the cell nucleus, causing two distinct regions of the DNA to fuse during the repair process, like merging the pages of different books. Prof. Conn notes that multiple circular RNAs seem to work in partnership, causing breaks at multiple DNA sites. This process, called chromosomal translocation, poses a significant challenge to cells as it results in gene fusions that can transform normal cells into cancerous cells. The researchers demonstrated this phenomenon in two different cell types, observing its role in the rapid onset of aggressive leukemia.

Respondents who listen to music while studying or working claim that instrumental music is often the go-to genre for better focus and relaxation.

Les particules plus petites ont une plus grande surface, ce qui est favorable, mais si elles deviennent trop petites, elles n’extraient pas bien la saveur. Un autre facteur important est la fraîcheur des grains. Au fil du temps, la saveur peut s’estomper à mesure que certains composés s’échappent. de mirarse en el espejo, explica un nuevo estudio. Un equipo internacional descubrió que las personas pasan una sexta parte de su vida tratando de mejorar su apariencia física. Eso equivale a cuatro horas al día, todos los días, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, jóvenes y mayores, según los investigadores. Entonces, ¿por qué los seres humanos tienen una obsesión tan grande con su apariencia? Utilizando una encuesta global a más de 93,000 personas en 93 países, el equipo descubrió que una de las razones es bastante obvia: las personas quieren lucir bien para atraer a un compañero sentimental. Sin embargo, en la era digital, el estudio también encontró que las personas tienden a preocuparse más por su apariencia si pasan más tiempo en las redes sociales. Para los obsesionados con las redes sociales, los investigadores dicen que muchos están dedicando todo este tiempo persiguiendo estándares de belleza poco realistas.

Malaria is caused by several species of a parasite carried by female mosquitoes. Symptoms include fever, chills, headache, muscle pain and fatigue. Nausea, diarrhea, and vomiting are also common. It can be life-threatening, with organ damage, including kidney failure, seizures, and coma. Symptoms typically start about 10 days to 4 weeks after infection, but people can get sick as late as a year after their initial infection.

Melatonin has become a popular dietary supplement known for assisting people to fall or stay asleep. Long before it came in a jar, however, melatonin was known for being a natural hormone produced by your brain in response to darkness. It plays a role in your body’s 24-hour internal clock (circadian rhythm) and in sleep. Exposure to light at night (light pollution) can block melatonin production.

ADELAIDE, Australia — Your risk for cancer may be linked to something deep inside your body. Australian researchers have established a significant connection between a person’s cancer risk and the functions of circular RNAs (circular genetic fragments) found within our cells. The findings reveal that specific circular RNAs can bind to DNA in our cells, leading to DNA mutations that can cause cancer.

Something to be wary of is if you have a more serious case of acid reflux and your doctor prescribes you proton pump inhibitors (PPIs), you could end up worse off. Prior research has shown that taking PPIs for extended periods of time can cause serious kidney damage. But, Dr. Ziyad Al-Aly, the author of this latest study out of Washington University in St. Louis says that “the onset of acute kidney problems is not a reliable warning sign for clinicians to detect a decline in kidney function among patients taking proton pump inhibitors.” The study indicates that “kidney problems can develop silently and gradually over time, eroding kidney function and leading to long term damage, or even renal failure,” according to Dr. Al-Aly. These results show that PPIs should be used only if truly needed and with close monitoring by medical professionals.

The sea squirt, or tunicate, belongs to a wonderfully diverse group of marine invertebrates that share a distant relation to mammals. Their modern counterparts are found worldwide, from polar regions to the tropics, floating freely in the water or anchored to surfaces like rocks, docks, and ship hulls. These creatures earned the name “sea squirts” because they react to touch by tensing up and expelling water from their siphons.

Un groupe a été exposé à des articles de presse encourageant la mobilité économique, tandis que l’autre groupe a été exposé à l’opposé. Cette étude a été menée quatre fois au total. When it’s time to grab a drink, what’s your preference? If you’re a fan of craft beer, you might be familiar with IPAs (India Pale Ale). More than a third of children don’t feel represented in the books they read – because of their gender or ethnicity. beauty standards affect our kids, but they can affect adults too. Human beings can’t stop looking at themselves in the mirror, a new study explains. An international team finds that people spend one-sixth of their lifetime trying to enhance their physical appearance. That’s four hours a day, every day, for both men and women, the young and the old, according to researchers. So, why do humans have such an obsession with how they look? Using a global survey of over 93,000 people in 93 countries, the team finds that one of the reasons is fairly obvious — people want to look good to attract a lover. However, in the digital age, the study also finds that people are more likely to fuss over their appearance if they spend more time on social media. For the social media-obsessed, researchers say many are spending all this time chasing unrealistic standards of beauty.

Just because you have nutritional deficiencies and are on the pill, it doesn’t mean that the pill is causing them. Aside from being in bizarre cravings, pickled foods may have health benefits beyond tasting good. New research shows how this food, that usually takes a back seat in most dishes, can actually have a profound effect on your body and mind. Scientists reveal that pickled capers contain a key compound which improves brain and heart health. Capers are the immature flower buds of a wild bush (the caper bush) which grows in the Mediterranean. In the United States, capers are commonly pickled for use as a garnish on dishes like smoked salmon and cream cheese bagels.

Cela étant dit, vous avez été prévenu. Si vous souhaitez vous lancer dans la préparation des pâtes, cependant, la science peut en réalité nous indiquer comment faire cuire les meilleures pâtes. Il s’avère que la première étape pour cuire une délicieuse casserole de pâtes est de les faire bouillir sans couvercle. Cela permet aux composés chlorés et iodés vaporisés de quitter les aliments et l’eau. La deuxième méthode consiste à égoutter les pâtes de l’eau de cuisson pour éliminer la plupart des contaminants. Vous devriez également ajouter du sel de table iodé après la cuisson des pâtes pour réduire le risque de formation de sous-produits. Enfin, si vous insistez pour faire bouillir vos pâtes dans de l’eau salée, optez pour des sels sans iode tels que le sel casher et le sel de l’Himalaya pour éviter les réactions chimiques nocives.

In addition to the love you receive from your dog, there are some other benefits. It turns out man’s best friend is taking a real bite out of crime! Researchers from The Ohio State University have found that neighborhoods that are home to more dogs also experience less crime — including murder and assault. A lot of this has to do with trust. Study authors found that, overall, communities are safer when people have more trust in their neighbors. However, crime dropped even further in neighborhoods with high levels of trust and more dogs. Researchers say you don’t have to have an actual “watchdog” to keep your streets safe. Their results suggest that more people walking their dogs puts more “eyes on the street,” which discourages criminals from committing both violent and non-violent crimes. Comforting to know!

The shape of DNA is normally a double-stranded helix, similar in appearance to a twisted ladder. It acts as the main source of genetic information. Last year, the researchers discovered a single-stranded DNA that folds in a form that allows it to mimic GFP activity. The DNA molecule, nicknamed “lettuce” for the green color it emits, works by binding to another small organic molecule. Binding to the fluorescent molecule and squeezing it produces its glow-in-the-dark features. The combination was recently successful as a fluorescent tag for detecting SARS-CoV-2, the viral cause of COVID-19.

The question is, do professional sports promote patriotism beyond kicking things off with a rendition of the national anthem? Most Americans say no. According to new research out of Ohio State University, less than half of surveyed U.S. adults (47%) agree with the notion that pro sports promote patriotism. Additional findings are that 34 percent believe pro sports teaches respect for the military. Moreover, just a third agree that pro sports can guide people on how to ‘be American.’” The lead study author says that patriotic imagery and messages are all too common in sports now, so much so that they go unnoticed. Based on the results of the study, researchers say that “it seems that most Americans do not recognize sport as a social institution that promotes nationalism – although there is good evidence that it does.” They recognize that further research is needed.

To delve deeper into the link between taurine and a healthy lifespan, Parminder Singh and a team of researchers measured blood taurine concentrations at different ages in mice, monkeys, and humans. The study showed a significant decline in taurine levels with age. For instance, 15-year-old monkeys had taurine concentrations 85 percent lower than their five-year-old counterparts. Similarly, taurine levels decreased by over 80 percent throughout the human lifespan. Aging mice also experienced declining taurine levels, and mice lacking the primary taurine transporter had shorter lifespans.

Taurine, a semi-essential micronutrient, is abundantly present in animals, including humans. Previous studies have indicated that taurine deficiency during early life can lead to functional impairments in skeletal muscle, eyes, and the nervous system, which are often associated with aging-related disorders. While small clinical trials have shown potential benefits of taurine supplementation in metabolic and inflammatory diseases, the influence of taurine levels on overall health and lifespan remains poorly understood.

If you do suffer from heartburn or any other gastrointestinal disorder, you may be surprised to learn that it’s extremely common – as in, almost half of all adults worldwide suffer from these issues. Research finds that four in ten adults around the world are battling some type of gastrointestinal disorder. Over 73,000 people in 33 countries were surveyed about their stomach issues. Nearly half of the women questioned were found to have at least one functional gastrointestinal disorder (FGID). And these FGIDs can show up in a variety of forms such as heartburn, acid reflux, indigestion, constipation, bloating, or even irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). And, unfortunately, those suffering from FGIDs are likely to visit the doctors more often than those without these issues. They’re also more likely to undergo surgical procedures.

por la falta de sueño y otros factores, pero en algunos casos, se deben a la genética. Una causa común es el adelgazamiento de la piel alrededor de los ojos, que puede ser heredado. Esta piel delgada hace que los vasos sanguíneos debajo sean más visibles, lo que resulta en la apariencia de ojeras. La falta de sueño y la fatiga también contribuyen a las ojeras, ya que pueden hacer que los vasos sanguíneos se dilaten y sean más notorios. Además, factores como la exposición excesiva al sol, las alergias y la deshidratación pueden provocar la aparición de ojeras. Algunos hábitos de vida como fumar, consumir alcohol y una mala alimentación pueden empeorar el problema. Por último, el envejecimiento puede desempeñar un papel, ya que la pérdida de colágeno y grasa en el área debajo de los ojos puede hacer que los vasos sanguíneos sean más prominentes, resultando en ojeras.

That being said, you’ve been warned. If you want to jump in to prepping pasta, though, science may actually tell us how to successfully make the best noodles. It turns out the first step to cooking a delicious pot of pasta is to boil it without a lid. This lets vaporized chlorinated and iodinated compounds leave the food and water. The second way is to strain your noodles from the water they’re cooking in to remove most contaminants. You should also add iodized table salt after cooking the pasta to lower your risk of byproduct formation. Lastly, if you insist on boiling your pasta in salted water, opt for iodine-free salt options like kosher salt and Himalayan salt to avoid harmful chemical reactions.

No muchos expertos en salud argumentarán que el desayuno sigue siendo la comida más importante del día, por varias razones. Y, según un estudio reciente, desayunar antes de las 8:30 a.m. puede ayudar a reducir el riesgo de diabetes. El estudio realizado por investigadores de la Universidad Northwestern muestra que las personas que han desayunado antes de las 8:30 a.m. tenían niveles más bajos de azúcar en la sangre y menos resistencia a la insulina. Los hallazgos sugieren que desayunar antes de las 8:30 a.m. ayuda a combatir el riesgo de diabetes, independientemente de la hora del día en que dejes de comer. Es bueno que los restaurantes de comida rápida comiencen a servir desayuno a partir de las 5 a.m., pero por razones de salud, es importante no abusar de la comida rápida.

SAN ANTONIO, Texas — Imagine a world where you could eat all the sugary and fatty foods you want without gaining weight or harming your health. Sounds too good to be true, right? They have developed a small-molecule drug that prevents weight gain and protects the liver in mice that eat a high-sugar, high-fat Western diet throughout their lives. The research offers hope for combating the negative effects of unhealthy eating.

Saviez-vous que l’argent peut en fait vous acheter le bonheur ? C’est vrai, l’argent que vous dépensez pour votre prochain voyage peut le faire. Dans une nouvelle étude, des chercheurs de plusieurs universités britanniques ont découvert que passer du temps dans la nature a été prouvé bénéfique pour la santé mentale, et qu’une demi-heure passée dans des environnements naturels en plein air maximise les sentiments de bonheur et de rafraîchissement. Mais ces bienfaits ne peuvent être obtenus que dans certains environnements : les sentiments de bonheur et de rafraîchissement étaient les plus élevés lorsqu’ils passaient du temps dans des zones rurales ou côtières ou dans des zones naturelles protégées ou désignées, comme les parcs nationaux. Il semble qu’une visite dans un parc national puisse être exactement ce dont vous avez besoin si vous cherchez à acheter un peu de bonheur.

Emotional support animals (ESA) are not considered service animals (like, for instance, guide dogs for the blind) under the American Disabilities Act (ADA) since they lack special training. Of course all dogs love their owners, but some are too independent, nervous, or stubborn to provide cuddles when needed or help their owner meet new people. Atherosclerosis occurs when fat builds up in the arteries on the interior walls of blood vessels. This buildup is more commonly referred to as plaque and causes vessels to narrow in diameter. This makes it more difficult for your blood to properly circulate. The plaques can also rupture and form clots that greatly obstruct the flow of blood, leading to heart attacks and strokes.

Des chercheurs de l’Université du Colorado à Boulder ont étudié un groupe de 291 adultes non jardiniers âgés en moyenne de 41 ans de la région de Denver. La moitié des participants ont été assignés à un groupe de jardinage communautaire, tandis que l’autre moitié a été placée dans un groupe témoin qui devait attendre un an avant de commencer le jardinage. Le groupe de jardinage communautaire a fini par consommer en moyenne 1,4 gramme de fibres de plus par jour que le groupe témoin. Cela représente une augmentation de 7 %. Le groupe de jardinage était également plus actif physiquement, d’environ 42 minutes par semaine. De plus, leurs niveaux de stress et d’anxiété ont diminué.

In 1948 when CBS chose Douglas Edwards to present a televised news program every weeknight, it birthed the role of a newscaster. He would also host the televised coverage of the Republican and Democratic national conventions of the same year. This started a whole new medium for television, which was relatively new, having only been invented some 20 years prior. Broadcasting the news on TV was now a job that would evolve over the years, with many different people taking the title and making it their own. However, it wouldn’t be till three years later that the official term news “anchor” would be created.

con datos sobre los 20,000 espacios verdes públicos de Londres, lo que les permitió explorar los efectos de la proximidad a áreas verdes en el bienestar. ¿Y los resultados? BALTIMORE — Hyposmia, or a reduced sense of smell, has been linked to Alzheimer’s disease and other forms of dementia in the past. Now, new research by a team at Johns Hopkins Medicine finds that a poor sense of smell is also associated with depression in older individuals. The project tracked over 2,000 community-dwelling older adults over the course of eight years. Study authors collected a significant amount of compelling evidence pointing to a link between decreased sense of smell and risk of developing late-life depression.

But even if their protective instincts aren’t the strongest, dogs can literally smell danger — or rather, they can smell stress. “The findings [of an Irish study] show that we, as humans, produce different smells through our sweat and breath when we are stressed and dogs can tell this apart from our smell when relaxed – even if it is someone they do not know,” explained researcher Clara Wilson of the School of Psychology at Queen’s University Belfast. “The research highlights that dogs do not need visual or audio cues to pick up on human stress. This is the first study of its kind and it provides evidence that dogs can smell stress from breath and sweat alone, which could be useful when training service dogs and therapy dogs.”

have become so widespread in the United States, it’s hard not to notice some of our favorite snacks at the grocery store have created their own gluten-free versions. The gluten-free movement was launched for people with Celiac disease, an ailment that prohibits the body from digesting gluten normally and can cause some uncomfortable side effects for sufferers. Celiac patients have good reason to go gluten-free: a regular diet might cause diarrhea or painful bloating, flatulence, and heartburn, and can lead to weight loss and malnutrition. The chronic disease can be found in the lining of the small intestine and since it’s incurable, the gluten-free diet is the best line of defense. But researchers have made an interesting discovery in tracking Americans who follow gluten-free diets: while an estimated 2.7 million people restrict their diet to gluten-free foods, only 1.76 million Americans actually suffer from the disease that requires the diet.

There are many conflicting views on how the keto diet can affect your health, but, according to a new study, the trendy keto diet could actually help fight cancer. Scientists in New York found that these diets help starve tumors of the glucose they need to grow. Experiments revealed that high-fat, low-carb meals also sped up a lethal wasting disease in pancreatic and colorectal cancer mice. Extreme weight loss, called cachexia, happens in some patients, leading to loss of appetite, fatigue, and immune suppression. The study authors explain that keto causes toxic blood fats called lipids to kill cancer cells. Replacing the depleted hormone with an anti-inflammatory corticosteroid meant keto still shrank tumors but didn’t kickstart cachexia or extreme weight loss.

HIV-1 poses a challenge for eradication due to its ability to form latent infections in cells, where the virus remains inactive and unaffected by antiretroviral therapy (ART). Although ART can inhibit viral replication, it cannot fully cure HIV. Reactivating and eliminating these latent HIV reservoirs is essential for a potential cure, and the Japanese team has made progress in identifying a compound that can activate these reservoirs.

NEW YORK — More than one in three Americans don’t know the true meaning of Independence Day. That’s according to a new OnePoll survey that tested the patriotic knowledge of 1,000 U.S. respondents, 99 percent of whom identified as either a born or naturalized citizen of the United States. When asked what July 4th is meant to officially commemorate, only 59 percent gave the correct answer: “The signing of the Declaration of Independence.”

El DJ es el maestro de ceremonias, la persona con la lista de reproducción y el ritmo que impulsa la pista de baile. Abreviatura de “Disc Jockey” (discotecario), un DJ puede ser muchas cosas. Originalmente, un término para los anfitriones de la radio terrestre, cautivaron a Estados Unidos con éxitos musicales y entretenidas conversaciones. En la década de 1980, el DJ era un maestro de mezcla de discos que creaba ritmos para grupos de rap como Salt-N-Pepa, Run-D.M.C. y Sugar Hill Gang. En el lenguaje moderno, un DJ es el maestro de la música electrónica de baile (EDM) y una especie de celebridad trotamundos que colabora con todas las estrellas de la lista de éxitos. Es este último grupo el que es el enfoque de los cinco mejores DJs, según nuestras fuentes.

Traveling to professional sporting events is nothing new for Americans. We love our sports and we’re loyal to our teams. However, another recent study suggests that simply getting out to watch a live sports event – whether it’s professional or amateur sports – is beneficial for your mental health. Scientists at Anglia Ruskin University say that attending live sporting events actually helps increase overall mental well-being and reduces feelings of loneliness. A survey of 7,000 adults found that those respondents who attended live sporting events scored better in terms of life satisfaction than those who had not recently attended events. That’s definitely a great reason to get out and watch your favorite NFL running backs carve up defenses in the fall.

Le houmous est devenu si populaire en tant que collation prête à manger qu’il fait désormais partie du petit-déjeuner ! Selon un sondage, 29 % des 2 000 personnes interrogées déclarent régulièrement déguster du pain à l’avocat ou du pain au houmous comme repas du matin. Qui mange ça ? Selon l’enquête, les hommes âgés de 25 à 34 ans choisissent le pain à l’avocat et au houmous pour le petit-déjeuner plus que tout autre groupe démographique. Speaking of fast food restaurants, a recent study found that fast food menus are more unhealthy now than they were 30 years ago. Researchers at Boston University analyzed menu items at several of the most popular fast-food restaurants in the United States in 1986, 1991, and 2016. The research team found that fast-food entrees, sides, and desserts have increased significantly in total calories, and sodium over the study period. The portion size of fast-food entrees and desserts has also grown since the 1980s, and the variety of entrée, side, and dessert options across these menus has increased by over 200 percent.

Si sufres de acidez estomacal u otro trastorno gastrointestinal, es posible que te sorprenda saber que es extremadamente común; casi la mitad de todos los adultos en todo el mundo padecen estos problemas. La investigación indica que cuatro de cada diez adultos en todo el mundo están lidiando con algún tipo de trastorno gastrointestinal. Se encuestó a más de 73,000 personas en 33 países sobre sus problemas estomacales. Casi la mitad de las mujeres encuestadas se encontraron con al menos un trastorno gastrointestinal funcional (FGID, por sus siglas en inglés). Estos FGID pueden manifestarse de diversas formas, como acidez estomacal, reflujo ácido, indigestión, estreñimiento, distensión abdominal e incluso síndrome del intestino irritable (SII). Desafortunadamente, aquellos que sufren de FGID suelen visitar al médico con más frecuencia que aquellos sin estos problemas. También tienen más probabilidades de someterse a procedimientos quirúrgicos.

En 1948, cuando CBS eligió a Douglas Edwards para presentar un programa de noticias televisado todas las noches de la semana, se dio inicio al papel de un presentador de noticias. También sería el anfitrión de la cobertura televisada de las convenciones nacionales republicanas y demócratas del mismo año. Esto inició un nuevo medio para la televisión, que era relativamente nuevo, ya que solo se había inventado unos 20 años antes. Transmitir noticias en la televisión se convirtió en un trabajo que evolucionaría a lo largo de los años, con muchas personas diferentes asumiendo el título y haciéndolo propio. Sin embargo, pasarían tres años más antes de que se creara el término oficial “anchor” (ancla) de noticias.

The researchers meticulously measured the carbon dioxide levels in various champagne vintages aged for multiple decades and estimated the original amount of yeast-produced carbon dioxide. El DJ es el maestro de ceremonias, la persona con la lista de reproducción y el ritmo que impulsa la pista de baile. Abreviatura de Disc Jockey, un DJ puede ser muchas cosas. Originalmente un término para los locutores de radio terrestre, cautivaron a Estados Unidos con discos de éxito y entretenimiento. En la década de 1980, el DJ era un maestro mezclador de rasguños de discos que ponía los ritmos para actos de rap como Salt-N-Peppa, Run-D.M.C. y Sugar Hill Gang. En el lenguaje moderno, un DJ es el maestro de la música electrónica de baile (EDM) y un tipo de celebridad que colabora con todas las estrellas en las listas de éxitos. Es este último grupo el que se centra en los cinco mejores DJs, según nuestras fuentes.

While some breeds are more responsive than others, since their domestication thousands of years ago the connection between humans and dogs has become so strong that even stray dogs understand — and respond to — human gestures. An Indian study suggests that dogs are born with an innate connection to humans that goes beyond stringent puppy training programs or learned commands. During the study, 80 percent of stray dogs followed gestures pointing them to a certain location, despite never having received any formal training. According to the research team, these results make it clear that dogs are capable of understanding complex human gestures and movements simply through observation.

Scientists from the University of Cambridge suggest that the unborn baby manages its mother’s metabolism, creating a nutritional “tug of war” during pregnancy. While the mother’s body seeks to maintain enough glucose and fats for her own health, the baby uses this paternal gene to maximize the nutrients it receives from the mother. This tug of war aids the mother in sustaining her health for childbirth, breastfeeding, and possible future pregnancies.

Conversely, another recent study highlights the harm that celebrities are able to cause. It’s fairly common knowledge these days that not all accounts and users on social media are actually real people. Some are “bots” programmed to convey and promote a particular political slant or talking point, while others just spam the web with advertisements. Interestingly, however, researchers from the University of Edinburgh find celebrities are actually bigger culprits than bots when it comes to spreading misinformation and harmful rhetoric on social platforms. Scientists report that comments and messages posted by bots on sensitive topics hold far less sway on actual human readers’ opinions than comments posted by celebrities on the same topics. More specifically, study authors say tweets shared by people with more than 10,000 followers appear to have the biggest influence on the views of the public.

Les chercheurs de l’Hôpital pour enfants de Philadelphie rapportent que plus de 6 500 enfants sont blessés chaque année dans des accidents liés aux voiturettes de golf. Ce qui est encore plus étonnant, c’est que les enfants de moins de 12 ans représentent plus de la moitié de ces accidents. Au cours d’une étude d’une durée de près de 10 ans, l’équipe de recherche a enregistré 63 501 blessures liées aux voiturettes de golf chez les enfants et les adolescents. Les blessures liées aux voiturettes de golf ont augmenté régulièrement d’année en année. L’étude a également révélé que les garçons sont plus souvent impliqués dans des accidents de voiturette de golf que les filles et que les blessures les plus courantes sont des coupures, des éraflures et des ecchymoses mineures.

Question, do you know who America declared its independence from in 1776? You may be surprised, but research reveals that two in three young adults have no clue. What’s more, one in three people don’t know how to spell “independence.” A poll of 1,030 Americans, commissioned by Lawsuit.org, found over a third spell independence incorrectly. Moreover, researchers add that internet searches for “how to spell independence” skyrocket by 85 percent during the July 4th holiday weekend. Researchers looked at searches to find many people spelling it “independance.” And less than 58 percent of all respondents correctly answered that America gained its freedom from Great Britain. Nearly eight percent said “Europe.” Over eight percent said “South America” and more than 12 percent chose “none of the above.” Sounds like it’s time to reopen the history books!

of Sheffield set out to learn about the connection between natural, green areas and mental wellbeing. Researchers reviewed data collected on 25,518 Londoners combined with data on London’s 20,000 public green spaces, which allowed them to explore the effects of proximity to greenery on wellbeing. And the results? Overall, they found a strong relationship between the amount of greenery near a person’s home and their mental health, and green spaces located within 300 meters — about .18 of a mile — of an individual’s home had the biggest impact. For example, an increase of just under 2.5 acres of greenery within 300 meters of a person’s home was associated with an eight-percentage point increase in life satisfaction, a seven-percentage point increase in self-worth, and a five-percentage point increase in happiness. Now you may be thinking of buying a house in the woods rather than just going on a camping trip.

In a recent study, researchers from the University of Michigan found that CGM’s, rather than a typical finger prick, significantly lowered hemoglobin A1C levels, which measure average blood sugars over a span of 3 months.

medida que envejecemos, es más probable que se desarrolle un deterioro cognitivo. Entonces, ¿cómo podemos entrenar nuestro cerebro para combatirlo? you think your backyard fireworks display will beat any show around, you may be disappointed to hear that, chances are, you’ve got nothing on a macronova. A what? A new type of stellar explosion. Researchers spotted the phenomenon on the surface of three white dwarfs as they fed on hydrogen and other materials from their companion stars. White dwarfs are the remnants of dead stars which have exhausted all of their fuel. And the team happened upon this new finding when they saw a brief, bright, flash of light while analyzing data from NASA’s Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS). Researcher Simone Scaringi said, “We have discovered and identified for the first time what we are calling a macronova.” He also mentions that “The phenomenon challenges our understanding of how thermonuclear explosions in stars occur. We thought we knew this, but this discovery proposes a totally new way to achieve them.”

Scientists make foam GeMs using a whipping siphon, essentially the same device countless baristas use to make foams on hot chocolate and coffee drinks. However, the team reverse-engineered this one to accept various gases, including oxygen. Hablando de restaurantes de comida rápida, un estudio reciente encontró que los menús de comida rápida son ahora más poco saludables que hace 30 años. Investigadores de la Universidad de Boston analizaron los elementos del menú en varios de los restaurantes de comida rápida más populares en Estados Unidos en 1986, 1991 y 2016. El equipo de investigación descubrió que los platos principales, acompañamientos y postres de comida rápida han aumentado significativamente en calorías totales y sodio a lo largo del período de estudio. El tamaño de las porciones de los platos principales y postres de comida rápida también ha crecido desde la década de 1980, y la variedad de opciones de platos principales, acompañamientos y postres en estos menús ha aumentado en más del 200 por ciento.

If you’re part of “Bachelor Nation” then you know, contestants on the show do some crazy things to stand out for the first meeting. But researchers from the University of California-Davis find first impressions matter big time in the dating world. Their study reveals that first impressions of both compatibility and popularity are very influential in shaping the people we choose to pursue as potential romantic partners. While both popularity and compatibility, in general, have been studied in plenty of earlier romantic research projects, this study is one of the first of its kind because it accounts for how first impressions affect subsequent romantic outcomes. Generally, researchers discovered that first impressions tend to linger around and influence whether people desire further contact with a potential romantic partner after a first meeting.

AURORA, Colo. — For decades, countless Americans have been taking benzodiazepines like Xanax, Valium, and Klonopin as a supposedly safe way to treat anxiety. Researchers from the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus report that both benzodiazepine usage and discontinuing usage of these drugs have a connection to nervous system injury and negative life effects.

Speaking of eating chicken, a recent study found that our ancestors would likely be horrified to learn that chickens are now food. A team of researchers from the University of Exeter in the United Kingdom found that our ancient ancestors once revered chickens to the point of burying their loved ones with cockerels and hens. The findings are based on chicken remains from over 600 sites in 89 countries, ranging from Morocco to Greece and South America, to Stonehenge and Orkney. Bones, locations, and historical records provided the research team with new insights into how local societies and cultures regarded the chicken.

EDINBURGH, Scotland — Wearing sunscreen while swimming in the sea may not be as harmful to ocean life as previously thought, according to a new study. Scientists previously expressed concerns about ultraviolet filters (UVFs), ingredients in sunscreens, after claims that they were harmful to corals. This led to the banning of UVFs in locations such as Hawaii and Palau. However, this new study indicates that the mix of chemicals in sunscreens may dilute the impact of individual harmful ingredients.

Para llevar a cabo este estudio, los investigadores dividieron a un grupo de estudiantes universitarios y consumidores adultos en dos grupos. A un grupo se le mostraron noticias que promovían la movilidad económica, mientras que al otro se le mostró lo contrario. Se realizó este estudio cuatro veces en total. Los investigadores descubrieron que si las personas creían que no podían cambiar su estatus económico, tenían menos control sobre el gasto impulsivo.

Researchers from the University of Colorado Boulder studied a group of 291 non-gardening adults with an average age of 41 from the Denver area. Half of the participants were assigned to a community gardening group, and the other half were put in a control group that was asked to wait one year to start gardening. The community gardening group ended up eating an average of 1.4 grams more fiber per day than the control group. That’s a 7% increase. The gardening group was also more physically active, by about 42 minutes per week. Plus, their stress and anxiety levels decreased too.

The ability to avoid cancer is called Peto’s Paradox. The theory first emerged from a famed epidemiologist named Richard Peto who made an interesting observation while out on the field. However, Peto noticed two of the largest animals on the planet — whales and elephants — don’t develop cancer.

Explica que las personas que consumen mucho café probablemente sean genéticamente tolerantes a la cafeína y puedan regular su consumo. Por otro lado, aquellos que no beben café o prefieren el descafeinado pueden tener reacciones adversas a la cafeína y correr el riesgo de desarrollar hipertensión. Scientists from Radboud University confirmed Stephen Hawking’s theory on black holes and their evaporation. Due to Hawking radiation, named for the famous scientist, black holes will eventually evaporate, but the event horizon is not as crucial to this as previously believed. This means that not only black holes but also other large objects in the universe, like remnants of dead stars, will eventually cease to exist.

You love your dog, and you know your dog loves you, but have you ever wondered why your little fur buddy loves you? It’s in their blood, literally. Researchers have found a genetic difference between dogs and wolves that explains why man’s best friend is so full of love. Thousands of years ago, early humans tried to feed wild wolves to use them to hunt and for protection. Some of the wolves took the free food and became the ancestors of domesticated dogs. The wolves that spurned early humans’ food stayed wild. The study by animal scientists at Oregon State University sheds more light on the differences in behavior between wolves and dogs. It’s the first to use genetic and behavioral data to try and understand how the domestication of wolves affected their genetics and shaped dogs’ behavior on a molecular level. Pretty cool, right?

But does your shampoo look good enough to eat? You’ve likely heard cautionary tales of young children ingesting substances, such as shampoo, but a study suggests it’s happening pretty frequently. Researchers found that 64,686 children under five were treated in U.S. emergency rooms between 2002 and 2016 due to injuries from personal care products. Those numbers work out to approximately one child visiting the ER every two hours. The most prevalent cause of seeking emergency care — 75 percent of admissions — was children swallowing a harmful product.

Experiments involving mice treated with TnP (T. nattereri peptide) revealed that they displayed no airway hyperreactivity or lung remodeling. The TnP molecule acted systemically on secondary lymphoid organs and locally in the lungs. It inhibited the production of cytokines Th2 and Th17 while also preventing hyperplasia of mucus-producing cells. Additionally, it reduced the thickening and deposition of sub-epithelial collagen. The authors of the study stated that TnP has the potential to be a candidate molecule for treating airway remodeling associated with inflammatory diseases like asthma.

If you often wonder if your pet is happy or what’s going on inside their mind, a new study is helping to answer just that question, revealing how man’s best friend perceives and imagines their favorite toys. A team with the Family Dog Project at Eötvös Loránd University has discovered that dogs have a “multi-modal mental image” of the objects they’re most familiar with at home. It means dogs can imagine their favorite balls, bones, and squeaking toys’ different sensory features. Basically, a dog’s brain can remember the way that toy looks and even smells before its owner brings it into the room—something to think about when shopping for your dog’s next toy or bed.

Sometimes shoppers can get a little carried away with non-essential treat purchases. You may save money buying items featured in those weekly grocery store flyers, but a new study finds you may not be cutting calories. Researchers at the University of Gothenburg in Sweden examined the weekly flyers from 122 local grocery stores during a four-week period, to assess the health quality of the foods in the ads. Their results find that most will likely pack on the pounds in an unhealthy way. “Our study reveals that the majority of grocery store advertisements promote unhealthy foods, going against recommended dietary guidelines,” says researcher Melissa Mjöberg in a university release.

En 1952, el jefe de noticias de CBS en ese momento, Sig Mickelson, utilizó el término “anchor” (ancla) para describir el trabajo de Walter Cronkite cubriendo la convención política. Derivado del término “anchor leg” en las carreras de relevos, Cronkite coordinaba los cambios entre puntos de noticias y reporteros, lo que le valió el título de “anchorman” (hombre ancla). Desde entonces, los presentadores y periodistas han adoptado el término y lo han definido como propio.

Curiosamente, los científicos han estado estudiando cómo hacer el espresso perfecto. Han analizado cómo se muelen los granos, la presión del agua e incluso los minerales presentes en el agua. Un dato relevante es que el tamaño de las partículas de café molido afecta el sabor. Las partículas más pequeñas tienen más superficie, lo cual es beneficioso, pero si son demasiado pequeñas, no extraen el sabor de manera adecuada. Otro factor importante es la frescura de los granos. Con el tiempo, el sabor puede disminuir a medida que ciertos compuestos se escapan. Y en cuanto al agua, es necesario que entre en contacto de manera uniforme con el café, algo que no siempre ocurre con las cafeteras comunes. Entonces, hacer una taza de espresso perfecta requiere mucha ciencia y técnica, pero las máquinas de espresso de alta gama pueden ayudar a eliminar la incertidumbre del proceso.

Research shows that a dog’s love for its human is in their blood, literally. A recent study has found a genetic difference between dogs and wolves that explains why man’s best friend is so full of love. The study determined that dogs have some of the same genetic markers as those who have Williams-Beuren Syndrome, a developmental disorder that often causes people to show “hypersocial” behavior. In behavioral tests comparing 10 human-socialized gray wolves and 18 dogs, researchers found that while both canines solved simple puzzles just as well with or without humans present, dogs had a particularly persistent habit of staring at the human with them. Wolves, on the other hand, kept their focus on the task regardless of a human nearby.

ne mangent pas d’œuf avant leur premier anniversaire ont plus de risques de développer une allergie à cet aliment en grandissant. Des chercheurs de l’American College of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology affirment qu’une intolérance aux œufs est la deuxième allergie alimentaire la plus courante dans le monde. Les allergies aux œufs se manifestent souvent par des éruptions cutanées, de l’eczéma, des vomissements occasionnels, voire une anaphylaxie. Être allergique aux œufs peut également entraîner le développement de l’asthme chez les patients plus âgés. Les auteurs de l’étude conseillent désormais aux parents de commencer à introduire les œufs dans l’alimentation de leurs enfants à partir de six mois afin de prévenir le développement d’une allergie. Les responsables de la santé recommandent généralement de donner de petites portions d’œuf lorsque les bébés commencent à manger des aliments solides. Plus précisément, les experts recommandent de commencer par des morceaux de jaune allergie aux œufs.

Les protéines sont les éléments constitutifs des muscles, et il s’avère que plus vous avez de muscles sur votre corps, plus il est facile de brûler les graisses tenaces. Mais certains aliments que vous consommez peuvent ne pas contenir les neuf acides aminés essentiels. On the night of what should have been a feather in the cap of Will Smith’s film career was instead overshadowed by his own unfortunate reaction to a joke gone wrong. Will Smith’s slap across the face of comedian Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars will sadly live on forever as one of the most unforgettable moments in Academy Awards history. After Rock mocked the actor’s wife, Jada Pinkett Smith, who suffers from alopecia, Smith’s shocking response spoiled what would have otherwise been perhaps the pinnacle of his storied career. Fans and celebrities alike have been quite vocal about the incident, with many taking sides in the spat between the two Hollywood heavyweights. Now, a new poll shows that two in three Americans think Smith should actually be charged for his admittedly violent reaction.

un humain réagira rapidement à celui-ci. Établir un lien mutuel avec un chien guide est un élément important du succès de l’utilisation d’un animal d’assistance. Des chercheurs de l’Université Johns Hopkins ont testé dans quelle mesure les chiens étaient prêts à vérifier l’état de leur propriétaire en pleurs, mesurant la distance et la rapidité avec lesquelles ils se rendaient auprès de leurs proches. Les auteurs ont également mesuré le niveau de stress des chiens pendant le test et ont constaté que les chiens qui pouvaient rejoindre leurs propriétaires en pleurs présentaient des niveaux de stress inférieurs à ceux des chiens qui ne réagissaient pas. Ils estiment que cela signifie que, bien que les chiens soient perturbés par les pleurs, leur stress est atténué parce qu’ils peuvent agir. Il est important qu’un animal d’assistance et son utilisateur aient un lien étroit, car ils peuvent être confrontés à de nombreuses situations ensemble.

The ideal healthy diet, referred to as PURE, consists of three to four weekly servings of legumes, seven of nuts, two of fish, and 14 of mainly full-fat dairy – excluding butter or whipped cream. James Marshall Hendrix est né en 1942 et les décennies troublées et marquées par la guerre qui ont suivi l’ont façonné en tant que musicien. Pendant cette période frénétique de quatre ans, Hendrix a réussi non seulement à capturer l’esprit du pays, mais aussi à laisser une empreinte indélébile dans l’histoire de la musique. Sa musique était révolutionnaire et totalement originale dans sa présentation des riffs de guitare.

estudio reciente destaca el daño que las celebridades pueden causar. Hoy en día es bastante conocido que no todas las cuentas y usuarios en las redes sociales son personas reales. Algunos son “bots” programados para transmitir y promover un determinado sesgo político o punto de vista, mientras que otros simplemente inundan la web con anuncios publicitarios. Curiosamente, sin embargo, investigadores de la Universidad de Edimburgo encuentran que las celebridades son en realidad los principales culpables en la difusión de información errónea y retórica dañina en las plataformas sociales. Los científicos informan que los comentarios y mensajes publicados por bots sobre temas sensibles tienen mucho menos influencia en las opiniones de los lectores humanos que los comentarios publicados por celebridades sobre los mismos temas. Específicamente, los autores del estudio afirman que los tweets compartidos por personas con más de 10.000 seguidores parecen tener la mayor influencia en las opiniones del público.

If one of your motivations for getting a dog is to get your feet moving more frequently, you’re on the right track. Dr. Carie Frantz of Weber State University has been spearheading research at the lake, focusing on the microbialite reefs, which are integral to the lake’s ecosystem. Microbialites are rocky structures formed by the accumulation of carbonate minerals produced by microbial mats. These microbial communities, which include algae and cyanobacteria, are fundamental to the lake’s food chain, as they engage in photosynthesis and sustain larger organisms like brine shrimp and flies.

Cirrhosis, characterized by irreversible scarring of the liver, is the third leading cause of mortality and loss of working life in the U.K. Patients with cirrhosis often have an imbalance of harmful bacteria in their bowels, rendering them highly susceptible to infections. Moreover, overuse of antibiotics has led to the rise of drug-resistant infections, making treatment increasingly challenging. The PROMISE trial aims to address these issues and evaluate the efficacy of FMT capsules in reducing infections among cirrhosis patients.

Macrocollum itaquii, which roamed South Brazil approximately 225 million years ago, is the oldest dinosaur ever studied with air sac structures. These bone cavities, also found in modern birds, played a vital role in helping dinosaurs capture more oxygen, regulate body temperature, and survive the harsh conditions of their time. It’s these adaptations that allowed some dinosaurs, like the mighty Tyrannosaurus rex and Brachiosaurus, to grow into massive creatures.

Instead of calling people “copycats,” you might want to think about saying “copy-dogs,” according to a study. New research out of Hungary finds that puppies (not kittens or wolf pups) instinctively imitate human actions, even without any training or a food reward. Puppies could copy someone’s behavior for a number of reasons. They may imitate what people do as a way of navigating new situations. They could also mimic others to learn new skills or information. An alternative explanation is that imitation breeds flattery. Impersonating another creature could be an evolutionary tactic to get into someone’s good graces and up their social standing.

The overarching COSMOS study is a well-designed double-blind randomized control trial. Desde “All Shook Up” hasta “Uptown Girl” y “Uptown Funk”, la música ha pasado por muchos cambios a lo largo de las décadas. No solo estilísticamente, sino también en cuanto a las letras. Según una nueva investigación, las letras de las canciones pop se han vuelto más oscuras y atrevidas con el tiempo. Investigadores de la Universidad Tecnológica de Lawrence estudiaron las letras de canciones populares desde la década de 1950 hasta 2016. Utilizando análisis cuantitativos, los científicos marcaron las tendencias de los sentimientos líricos en canciones que abarcan siete décadas. En sus resultados, los científicos de datos de la universidad y coautores Kathleen Napier y Lior Shamir escribieron que su investigación muestra un “cambio claro y estadísticamente significativo en los sentimientos expresados a través de las letras de la música popular, generalmente hacia un tono más negativo”.

Oriental afirman que tanto los padres como las madres que practican lo que predican en cuanto a hábitos alimenticios pueden marcar la diferencia en la alimentación saludable de los niños de tres a cinco años. El estudio analizó la relación entre el entorno alimentario en el hogar y las acciones parentales en el consumo de verduras y frutas entre niños pequeños. Inculcar hábitos alimenticios saludables en los niños desde una edad temprana a menudo conduce a patrones dietéticos que perduran hasta la edad adulta. Entonces, si los padres pueden convencer a sus hijos de comer verduras a los cinco años, es muy probable que sigan comiendo verduras a los 35 años. En total, 114 niños en edad de jardín de infantes y sus padres participaron en la investigación a través de una serie de encuestas. Se analizaron por separado las verduras crudas, las verduras cocidas, las frutas y las bayas.

For many, mulching is more than keeping up with curb appeal, it’s therapeutic. In fact, a recent study found that gardening benefits our mental health. How so? Gardening has been found to lower stress, anxiety, and depression for people with existing medical conditions and challenges. The study included 32 women, all of which had a history of taking prescription medication for either depression or anxiety. Approximately half of the participants took part in a gardening class, meeting twice a week for eight weeks. Compared to the other group who took part in a similar art class, the gardening group reported less anxiety. Perhaps in the future, larger-scale studies will reveal more about how gardening is correlated with changes in our mental health.

The recent study focused on women between 65 and 69 in Denmark who had no record of cervical cancer screening in the previous five-and-a-half years and no record of an HPV test between ages 60 and 64. Denmark provides a free cervical cancer screening program for women up to the age of 64.

Les scientifiques fabriquent les GeMs en mousse à l’aide d’un siphon fouet, essentiellement le même dispositif que de nombreux baristas utilisent pour faire de la mousse sur du chocolat chaud et des boissons au café. Cependant, l’équipe l’a inversé pour accepter différents gaz, dont l’oxygène. Les siphons fouets utilisent des composants sûrs et peu coûteux couramment présents dans de nombreux aliments transformés pour fabriquer les GeMs. En variant la quantité de chaque composant, ils ont pu contrôler la libération d’oxygène à partir du matériau.

De plus, profiter de la nature présente des avantages. Des scientifiques britanniques de l’Université de York affirment que s’engager régulièrement dans des “activités basées sur la nature” peut améliorer la santé mentale des adultes, même ceux qui souffrent déjà d’un problème de santé mentale préexistant. Leurs recherches montrent que des activités basées sur la nature durent entre 20 et 90 minutes et sont pratiquées régulièrement pendant huit à douze semaines, ce qui a le plus grand impact sur l’amélioration de l’humeur, la réduction de l’anxiété et l’augmentation de la positivité globale.

Despite the various sources available, over 41% of Americans are vitamin D deficient. Scientists are still working to understand vitamin D metabolism because all of the possible reasons for deficiency prevalence are still unclear. A diet low in vitamin-rich foods and lack of sunlight are two key explanations, but there is still a lack of understanding on a deeper level. For example, African Americans have deficiency rates that are nearly double that of the general population. At the same time, they tend to have higher bone density and a lower risk of osteoporosis compared to Caucasians.

En parlant de restaurants de fast-food, une étude récente a révélé que les menus des fast-foods sont maintenant plus mauvais pour la santé qu’il y a 30 ans. Des chercheurs de l’Université de Boston ont analysé les éléments des menus de plusieurs des restaurants de fast-food les plus populaires aux États-Unis en 1986, 1991 et 2016. L’équipe de recherche a constaté que les plats principaux, les accompagnements et les desserts des fast-foods ont considérablement augmenté en termes de calories totales et de sodium au cours de la période étudiée. La taille des portions des plats principaux et des desserts des fast-foods a également augmenté depuis les années 1980, et la variété des options de plats principaux, d’accompagnements et de desserts sur ces menus a augmenté de plus de 200 %.

Researchers in the Netherlands conducted a study with over 500 participants and found that people are more likely to remember where high-calorie foods are located over healthier options. A team of researchers from Wageningen University and Research believes the human brain has evolved to focus on memorizing where high-calorie foods are located and that this evolution allowed our hunter-gatherer ancestors to survive in environments where food was scarce. Over 11,000 eligible women residing in one region of Denmark were invited to participate in HPV-based cervical cancer screenings. Although these women did not receive a screening invitation, they could still opt for an opportunistic cervical cytology sample collection.

The fossilized creature, named Megasiphon thylakos, dwelt on the seafloor during the Cambrian era, a period of rapid evolution when most major animal groups first appeared on Earth. The animal underwent a remarkable transformation from a tadpole-like larva to a stationary, filter-feeding adult. One of its siphons drew in water laden with food particles, which the creature filtered internally. Once feeding was complete, the other siphon expelled the water.

As mentioned earlier, intelligence isn’t easy to measure and researchers employ different ways to do so. A team of Hungarian researchers, for instance, first examined two exceptionally talented dogs: border collie Whisky and Yorkshire terrier Vicky Nina. “We wanted to know under which conditions the gifted dogs may learn novel words. To test this, we exposed Whisky and Vicky Nina to the new words in two different conditions,” explained Claudia Fugazza, first author of the study. The researchers reported both dogs successfully learned a new toy’s name by playing with it, even after only hearing the word four times. The study then examined how well 20 other dogs remember new words using the same tests. Unlike Whisky and Vicky Nina, this group could not learn the new words after hearing them only four times. Whisky and Vicky Nina were much smarter than the average dog.

Incluso el empaque en el que se envuelve tu comida puede causar cáncer. El empaque que entra en contacto con los alimentos puede transferir fácilmente estos compuestos dañinos a los alimentos que luego se consumen.
