Deriving from the gittern, a guitar-like string instrument from the Middle Ages, acoustic guitars have been the backbone of the music world for centuries. Being one of the most famous and by far most played instruments in the world, the guitar has a long history encapsulating many different genres of music, from rock, blues, folk, jazz, and more. While the gittern differed in shape from the modern-day acoustic guitar, that design came in the Renaissance era, when the body started changing, and size expanded. cabello puede proporcionar pistas sobre futuros problemas de salud? Según nuevas investigaciones, las hormonas del estrés detectadas en nuestro cabello podrían predecir el riesgo de sufrir un ataque cardíaco o un derrame cerebral. Un equipo de investigación europeo investigó los niveles a largo plazo de cortisol y su forma inactiva, cortisona, encontrados en el cabello del cuero cabelludo. ¿Cómo? Utilizando los niveles de cortisol y cortisona en más de 6,000 muestras de cabello recolectadas de hombres y mujeres adultos participantes, los investigadores descubrieron que los participantes con niveles elevados de cortisol y cortisona tenían el doble de probabilidades de sufrir un evento cardiovascular durante su vida. Este riesgo aumentó a más de tres veces para las personas de 57 años o menos. Sin embargo, para aquellos mayores de 57 años, no se encontró una relación significativa entre los niveles de cortisol y cortisona en el cabello y las enfermedades cardiovasculares.

El patinaje sobre ruedas tiene una larga historia que se remonta a 1743, cuando un inventor belga llamado John Joseph Merlin creó el primer par de patines en línea hechos de madera y con ruedas en la parte inferior. El patín de cuatro ruedas conocido como “quad” tal como lo conocemos fue inventado en 1863 por James Plimpton. A partir de ahí, el patinaje sobre ruedas ganó impulso como pasatiempo popular, convirtiéndose en un icónico hobby de las coloridas décadas de los años 80 y 90 en Estados Unidos.

The new materials, called gas-entrapping materials (GeMs), come in the form of foams, solids, or hydrogels. Researchers specifically designed them to carry high concentrations of numerous therapeutic gasses directly into tissues, including tumors.

Resulta que tomar una cerveza con la cena cada noche puede ser beneficioso para tu intestino. Investigadores de la Universidad NOVA en Lisboa han descubierto que la cerveza puede aumentar las bacterias saludables en el intestino, ayudando a combatir enfermedades e infecciones. El secreto está en los polifenoles, compuestos vegetales que se encuentran en el lúpulo, la cebada y la levadura, que le dan a la cerveza su sabor distintivo. Incluso se encontró que la cerveza sin alcohol tiene los mismos beneficios, por lo que no es necesario perderse si no bebes alcohol. Aunque el estudio se realizó con una muestra relativamente pequeña, los resultados son interesantes. ¡Así que destapa una fría y brinda por un intestino más feliz!

Les menus des fast-foods se sont certainement élargis au fil des ans. Cependant, une idée fausse courante est que seules les familles à faible revenu mangent de la restauration rapide, et selon une étude récente, ce n’est tout simplement pas le cas. Des chercheurs de l’Université d’État de l’Ohio ont constaté que près de 80 % des personnes interrogées ont déclaré avoir mangé de la restauration rapide au moins une fois la semaine précédente. L’équipe de recherche s’est concentrée sur des répondants de classe moyenne supérieure et a constaté que même les Américains les plus riches mangent de la restauration rapide. Il s’avère que nous aimons tous de temps en temps un bon hamburger gras ou un sandwich au poulet.

Travailler dans le jardin peut être une activité potentiellement dangereuse. “Malgré les programmes d’éducation des consommateurs et les étiquettes d’avertissement, les blessures causées par les tondeuses à gazon aux États-Unis restent un problème de santé publique grave”, déclare l’auteur principal, le Dr Deborah Schwengel, professeur adjoint d’anesthésiologie et de médecine de soins intensifs à Johns Hopkins, dans une déclaration. Selon les résultats, 85,2 % des personnes blessées par une tondeuse à gazon étaient des hommes. Les enfants de moins de quatre ans étaient six fois plus susceptibles de subir une blessure au pied, aux orteils ou à une autre extrémité inférieure, et 1,7 fois plus susceptibles de nécessiter une amputation que les personnes de plus de 15 ans. Les utilisateurs de tondeuses à gazon de plus de 15 ans étaient huit fois plus susceptibles de subir une blessure à une extrémité supérieure que les autres.

Il se trouve que l’écoute de vos chansons préférées peut provoquer une “surcharge de plaisir” dans votre cerveau. Nous avons tous ressenti cette sensation joyeuse lorsque notre chanson préférée passe à la radio. Qu’est-ce qui provoque cette sensation électrisante ? Les auteurs de l’étude ont découvert une activité électrique spécifique dans le cortex orbitofrontal lorsque les amateurs de musique ressentent des frissons. Cette région est impliquée dans le traitement émotionnel. Il y avait également plus d’activité dans la zone motrice supplémentaire et le lobe temporal droit, qui gèrent le traitement auditif et l’appréciation musicale du côté droit du cerveau. Toutes ces régions travaillent ensemble pour aider les humains à traiter la musique, stimuler les centres de récompense du cerveau et libérer la dopamine, l’hormone du “bien-être”. Sans aucun doute, les cinq chansons de Prince suivantes ont cet effet.

le manque de sommeil et d’autres facteurs, mais pour certaines personnes, c’est une question de génétique. Une cause courante est l’amincissement de la peau autour des yeux, qui peut être héréditaire. Cette peau fine rend les vaisseaux sanguins en dessous plus visibles, ce qui donne l’apparence de cernes sombres. Le manque de sommeil et la fatigue sont également des facteurs connus de l’apparition des cernes, car ils peuvent provoquer la dilatation des vaisseaux sanguins et les rendre plus visibles. De plus, des facteurs tels qu’une exposition excessive au soleil, des allergies et la déshydratation peuvent entraîner l’apparition de cernes. Certaines habitudes de vie comme le tabagisme, la consommation d’alcool et une mauvaise alimentation peuvent aggraver le problème. Enfin, le vieillissement peut jouer un rôle, car la perte de collagène et de graisse dans la région sous les yeux peut rendre les vaisseaux sanguins plus saillants, entraînant l’apparition de cernes sombres.

Le café et les cartes de crédit peuvent être le pire cauchemar d’un planificateur financier, selon des chercheurs de l’Université de South Florida. Les scientifiques rapportent que les clients qui sirotent une tasse de café offerte avant de faire du shopping finissent par dépenser 50 % de plus et acheter 30 % d’articles de plus que leurs homologues non caféinés. “La caféine, en tant que puissant stimulant, libère de la dopamine dans le cerveau, ce qui excite l’esprit et le corps. Cela conduit à un état énergétique plus élevé, ce qui renforce l’impulsivité et diminue le contrôle de soi”, explique l’auteur principal de l’étude, Dipayan Biswas, professeur titulaire de la chaire Frank Harvey en marketing à l’USF, dans un communiqué de presse de l’université. “Par conséquent, la consommation de caféine entraîne une impulsivité dans les achats, se traduisant par un plus grand nombre d’articles achetés et une plus grande dépense”.

Burgers are not a new concept either. According to History, “the groundwork for the ground-beef sandwich was laid with the domestication of cattle (in Mesopotamia around 10,000 years ago), and with the growth of Hamburg, Germany, as an independent trading city in the 12th century, where beef delicacies were popular.” Fast forward to 1848 when the United States saw an increase in German immigration, bringing with them German beer gardens and traditional meat preparations. This prompted many restaurants to start serving a “Hamburg-style” chopped steak. By the 19th century, the hamburger had transitioned from being a ground beef patty served on a plate, to being placed in between two buns. Currently, nearly 50 billion hamburgers are consumed in just the United States per year.

Their study finds that both listening and learning to play music could prevent a decline in brain health. Loving music and enjoying it frequently could contribute to more robust mental health with age. Additional research has even shown that the right song at the right moment can turn a bad day around. Now, new findings from Michigan State University suggest our favorite tunes can also help give meds a boost. Researchers found that music-listening interventions appear to make medicines more effective. Clearly, music enriches our lives and helps us in unforeseen ways.

If you haven’t visited Rhode Island yet, you might want to start planning a trip. The smallest state in the United States is renowned for its rich history, captivating coastal beauty, and vibrant cultural scene. It earned the nickname “The Ocean State” due to its extensive coastline and picturesque beaches. Rhode Island is famous for its historic landmarks, including the opulent Gilded Age mansions of Newport, such as The Breakers and Marble House. The state is also home to prestigious institutions like Brown University and the Rhode Island School of Design, contributing to its reputation as an intellectual and artistic hub. Additionally, Rhode Island is celebrated for its delectable seafood cuisine, particularly clam chowder and fresh lobster rolls. The state’s unique charm, captivating landscapes, and significant cultural contributions make it a beloved destination for visitors and residents alike.

Dehydration occurs when your body loses more fluid than you’re taking in. About two-thirds of your body weight is water. Every cell needs water, and it’s the main substance in all of your bodily fluids – saliva, blood, tears, urine, sweat, joint fluid, and many more. Water is critical to heart health, gastrointestinal (GI) health, skin health, brain health, and just about everything else health-related.

Well, hold that thought, because research reveals that a compound in red wine gives similar benefits as both! Scientists at the Virginia Tech Carilion Research Institute have found that a compound in red wine has similar health benefits to following a low-calorie diet and exercising regularly. But, there is a caveat: The researchers found that the compound resveratrol is effective at preserving muscle fibers as we age, though they warn that red wine only offers a minimal amount to drinkers. Red wine, of course, cannot completely replace those healthy lifestyle habits.

ADELAIDE, Australia — The humble sea cucumber, a popular marine delicacy in Asia, is not only delicious but also holds the key to preventing diabetes, according to researchers from the University of South Australia. Researchers from the University of Southampton found that those who practice healthier eating habits throughout their adulthood tend to be more fit and stronger in older age. Just by changing your diet for the better, you can be on your way to a stronger body — and your future self will thank you for it. “Improving the quality of your diet can have a beneficial effect on health whatever your age,” contends lead author Sian Robinson, a professor of nutritional epidemiology, in a university news release. “However, this study suggests that making food dietary choices throughout adulthood – by cutting down on highly processed foods and incorporating more fruit, vegetables, and whole grains into your diet – can have a significant beneficial effect on strength and physical performance later in life, helping to ensure a much healthier old age.”

Moreover, the benefits that do show up might just be in people’s minds. Interestingly, scientists have been studying how to make the perfect espresso. They’ve looked at how the beans are ground, the pressure of the water and even the minerals in the water. One notable takeaway is that the size of the ground coffee particles affects the flavor. Smaller particles have more surface area, which is good, but if they get too small, they don’t extract the flavor as well. Another important factor is the freshness of the beans. Over time, the flavor can fade as certain compounds escape. And when it comes to the water, it needs to come into contact with the coffee evenly, which doesn’t always happen with regular coffee pots. So, there’s a lot of science and technique that goes into making that perfect cup of espresso, but high-end espresso machines can help take the guesswork out of the process.

Research shows that individuals who visit green spaces on a weekly basis and feel a certain level of connection to mother nature, feel better physically and mentally. In this first of its kind study, researchers from the University of Plymouth, Exeter University, the University of Derby, and Natural England set out to examine the relationship between humans and nature. More specifically, the positive health and well-being benefits humans receive from time spent in nature and whether a connection with nature produces pro-environmental action. Much good comes from spending time in nature, but do the benefits increase if, say, you live closer to a nature reserve or park?

Feeding your dog the correct diet can even result in less poop for you to scoop! The lowest pain rating was “no pain,” while the absolute highest rating was “pain as bad as it could possibly be.” Researchers separated the participants into two groups with distinct dieting plans lasting 16 weeks. The first group had to follow a strict vegan diet for four weeks, followed by the elimination of additional foods for the next three weeks. Then, over the next nine weeks, study authors reintroduced various eliminated foods to participants’ eating habits. Meanwhile, the second group had to stick with an “unrestricted diet” while also taking a daily placebo capsule. After each group completed their assignments, the participants switched diets for another 16 weeks. And you can probably guess what happened: joint pain decreased during the vegan phase of the diet. Also worth noting is the fact that another side effect was significant weight loss.

The belief makes sense: the survey showed that pet owners log nearly twice as much exercise, getting a good sweat about five times per week, versus just three time a week for the non-owners.

On a global scale, projections show that the amount of people living with mild to complete hearing loss will likely grow to roughly 2.5 billion by the middle of this century. The primary cause of such hearing loss is the death or loss of function of hair cells found in the cochlea. Those hair cells are key to hearing, as they are responsible for relaying sounds to the brain. Hair cells may die or lose function for any number of reasons, including mutations of critical genes, aging, and noise exposure.

Después del impacto, los investigadores del Field Museum en Chicago están examinando las heces finales que estas aves llevan consigo para hacer algunos descubrimientos sorprendentes sobre su salud intestinal única. A diferencia de los humanos, donde los microbios intestinales tienen una conexión específica con nuestra especie, el nuevo estudio revela que la composición intestinal de las aves es completamente diferente y en realidad cambia de una estación a otra. Normalmente, la relación entre los microbios de un mamífero y la comida que consume evoluciona a lo largo de millones de años. En el caso de las aves, parece que su entorno actual desempeña un papel mucho más importante.

Cela a ouvert une toute nouvelle voie pour la télévision, qui était encore relativement nouvelle, ayant été inventée seulement une vingtaine d’années auparavant. La diffusion des nouvelles à la télévision était maintenant un travail qui évoluerait au fil des ans, avec de nombreuses personnes différentes portant le titre et en faisant leur propre interprétation. Si vous aimez les climats froids, vous avez de la chance. Des chercheurs allemands ont découvert que des températures modérément froides augmentent la longévité d’une personne et réduisent la susceptibilité aux maladies liées à l’âge. Cela est dû au fait que le froid empêche les protéines dans votre corps de s’agglutiner, une condition associée à des maladies neurodégénératives telles que la sclérose latérale amyotrophique (SLA), la maladie d’Alzheimer ou la maladie de Huntington. Les chercheurs ont constaté qu’une baisse de température augmentait l’activité d’un mécanisme cellulaire qui élimine les protéines endommagées des cellules.

Research has long explored this phenomenon, and recently, a team of scientists at the Champalimaud Centre for the Unknown found that this strong association has to do with the neurons in the brain. The research team focused on the primary olfactory cortex, which sits in the front of the brain. To put these olfactory neurons to the test, the team developed a custom-made puzzle filled with different odors for rats to make their way through. The rats sampled odors at four ends of the plus-shaped maze. Then, depending on the scent, they had to figure out where to find the reward. While the animals were solving the puzzle, the researchers monitored the activity of their neurons in a part of the primary olfactory cortex called the posterior piriform cortex.

LOS ANGELES — Scientists have developed what may be a “holy grail” molecule that eradicates all solid cancer tumors while leaving other cells unaffected. The breakthrough was achieved by the team at the City of Hope Hospital, one of the largest cancer research and treatment organizations in the United States, and targets the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) protein.

la prise de probiotiques peut vous aider à éprouver moins de problèmes respiratoires. Dans l’étude, les chercheurs ont examiné les journaux de santé quotidiens de 220 patients dans le cadre d’une étude en double aveugle contrôlée par placebo axée sur les probiotiques et la perte de poids. Les auteurs de l’étude ont recherché tout signe de toux, de mal de gorge ou d’essoufflement – qui peuvent révéler une infection des voies respiratoires supérieures. Et les résultats ? Les participants prenant des probiotiques pendant l’expérience ont présenté un taux de développement de problèmes respiratoires inférieur de 27 % par rapport à ceux prenant un placebo. Les participants âgés de 45 ans et plus ont connu le plus grand bénéfice de la prise de probiotiques, ainsi que ceux qui étaient obèses. Et si vous avez besoin d’une autre raison de prendre des probiotiques, une souche en particulier peut prévenir la dégénérescence cérébrale.

In fact, a recent study found that just four ounces of fried food raises your risk of heart disease and stroke. If you have been turning to comfort foods more often than usual, check your stress levels. New research out of Australia, however, may have you second-guessing your next trip to the vending machine. Scientists at the Garvan Institute of Medical Research have found that when people combine stress with calorie-dense “comfort food,” it can actually spark changes in the brain that boosts cravings for sweets and other junk foods. Such dietary choices, of course, can eventually lead to unhealthy excess weight gain. The research team reports that chronic stress can override the brain’s natural response to satiety (feeling full and satisfied), which can lead to non-stop reward signals promoting the consumption of more highly palatable food.

to affirm that your beverage of choice benefits your health. Well, we’ll do you one better, research points to red wine aiding in your health. Research shows that red wine drinkers benefit from increased gut microbiota diversity. The study out of London set out to investigate the effects of red wine, white wine, cider, beer, and liquor on the gut microbiome and overall health of 916 U.K.-born female twins. Results show that red wine drinkers’ gut microbiomes were more diverse than participants who preferred other forms of alcohol. That’s right, red wine drinkers’ gut microbiota contained a larger number of different bacterial species compared to other participants. Researchers believe it is the polyphenols in red wine that is the cause of this beneficial diversity. And that’s just one of the five areas of research backing your choice to indulge in a nice glass of red. View the four others here.

activities such as riding a bike. In fact, there have been over one million broken bones reported from children riding bikes over the last 20 years. The research, a 20-year review, finds that most bone fractures occurred among 10- to 15-year-old boys. Despite efforts to make roads a more bike-friendly area, over 65,000 injuries occurred because of a collision with a car. And the numbers show why helmets are vital: Children who typically rode bikes without a helmet were the ones most likely to have an accident. About 85.7% of children with fractured skulls were not wearing helmets. There were 1,019,509 fractures in the past two decades with an average of 50,975 fractures related to bicycles every year. So, whether you’re an adult looking to add a new outdoor activity, or purchasing a bike for a child, it’s best to learn about bicycle safety before hitting the streets or trails.

Another recent study reveals that many 20-somethings are almost as familiar with oldies as with today’s top hits. We learn this by way of a recent song recognition experiment at New York University, in which nearly 650 millennials took part. Participants, mostly 18 to 25, were shown seven short snippets of one-time Billboard No. 1 hits, after each audio sample, participants were asked to identify the song played. Overall, songs released in the 21st century — 2000 to 2015 — were the best identified. Rihanna, though still a relevant and contemporary artist, now has songs that can reasonably be considered oldies or throwbacks due to their age in terms of original release date.

CHICAGO — Are water fasts an effective path toward sustained weight loss? Probably not, according to researchers from the University of Illinois Chicago. Study authors find that while a water fast (consuming nothing but water for several days) may help shed pounds in the short term, it’s unclear just how long that weight will stay away once solid foods come back into play.

Si vous faites partie de la “Bachelor Nation”, alors vous savez que les candidats de l’émission font des choses folles pour se démarquer lors de la première rencontre. Mais des chercheurs de l’Université de Californie-Davis ont découvert que les premières impressions sont d’une grande importance dans le monde des rencontres amoureuses. Leur étude révèle que les premières impressions de compatibilité et de popularité sont très influentes dans la sélection des personnes que nous choisissons de poursuivre comme partenaires potentiels. Alors que la popularité et la compatibilité ont été étudiées dans de nombreuses recherches antérieures sur les relations amoureuses, cette étude est l’une des premières du genre car elle tient compte de la manière dont les premières impressions influencent les résultats romantiques ultérieurs. En général, les chercheurs ont découvert que les premières impressions ont tendance à persister et à influencer le désir de revoir un partenaire potentiel après une première rencontre.

Zhu affirme que ses résultats montrent que les utilisateurs d’ordinateurs de bureau étaient plus enclins à une réflexion rationnelle lorsqu’il s’agissait de dépenser de l’argent en ligne, tandis que les utilisateurs d’écrans tactiles étaient plus enclins à ouvrir leur portefeuille pour des produits moins rationnels – ce qu’elle appelle une pensée “expérientielle”. To investigate the role of S. sputigena, the researchers analyzed plaque samples from over 400 children between the ages of three and five. They discovered that while S. sputigena alone does not cause tooth decay, it has a unique ability to collaborate with S. mutans, exacerbating the decaying process. The team found that S. sputigena becomes trapped by the sticky structures produced by S. mutans, leading to the rapid growth of S. sputigena and the formation of protective “superstructures” that shields S. mutans. This partnership intensifies acid production and worsens the severity of cavities.

The results reveal participants who received prucalopride displayed increased functional connectivity between major cognitive networks during resting-state scans. This included enhanced connectivity between the central executive network, responsible for processing thoughts, and the posterior and anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), which regulates information processing and attention. Additionally, there was heightened connectivity between regions of the ACC and the lateral occipital cortex, which involved object-focused attention. Conversely, medicated participants showed decreased connectivity within the default mode network, which is active during mind wandering.

“Our previous studies on prucalopride demonstrated that even at low clinical doses it can improve cognition and memory in healthy volunteers. This latest research provides a neurological mechanism by which this might occur,” lead author Angharad de Cates, PhD, MRCPsych, from the University of Oxford, explains in astatement..

But senescent cells aren’t always a good thing. They secrete a cocktail of inflammatory proteins that can spread to neighboring cells. Creen que esto significa que, aunque a los perros les molestaba el llanto, su estrés se aliviaba porque podían tomar medidas. Es importante que un animal de servicio y su manejador estén unidos, ya que pueden encontrarse con muchas situaciones entre sí.

dog that is bonded with a human will be fast to respond to them. Finding a mutual bond with a Seeing Eye dog is an important part of the success of having a service animal. Researchers at Johns Hopkins University tested the extent dogs would go to check upon the state of a crying owner, measuring just how far and fast they’d go to get to their loved ones. The authors also measured the dogs’ stress levels during the test, and found that the dogs who were able to reach their crying owners showed lower levels of stress than non-responsive dogs. They believe this means that, though the dogs were bothered by the crying, their stress was alleviated because they were able to take action. It is important that a service animal and their handler are bonded as there are many situations that the two may encounter with one another.

Entre 1990 et 2019, une campagne basée en Oregon appelée “Friends of Trees” a ajouté 49 246 arbres dans les rues de Portland – en tenant un registre des endroits et des dates auxquels ils l’ont fait. L’équipe a examiné le nombre d’arbres plantés dans une zone spécifique où vivaient environ 4 000 personnes au cours des cinq à quinze dernières années. All of these things are what you actively want to avoid for weight loss!

Según los autores del estudio, esta relación parece impactar en las ventas de películas. Si los críticos y los usuarios generalmente discuten los mismos aspectos de una película en sus reseñas, esta será más memorable y aumentará la probabilidad de que las personas vayan a verla. Las reseñas similares impulsan películas regulares; curiosamente, los hallazgos sugieren que esta asociación es más fuerte para películas con calificaciones de reseñas generalmente mediocres que para películas con fluctuaciones de calificaciones extremas. According to the results, 85.2% of lawnmower injury sufferers were men. Children under the age of four were six times more likely to have a foot, toe, or other lower extremity injury, and 1.7 times more likely to require amputation than those over 15 years old. The T. nattereri is a small fish that dwells in calm shallow coastal waters in North and Northeast Brazil. Locally known as niquim, an Indigenous term for fish, this toadfish possesses a venom apparatus comprising two dorsal and two lateral spines covered by a membrane connected to venom glands at the base of its fins. When the spines penetrate a victim, the venom is released into the duct via the integumentary sheath enclosing the gland. When stepped on or touched, the toadfish defends itself by injecting venom, causing intense pain, swelling, and potentially cell death.

The first image, taken in July 2022, showcases the Martian summer in the southern hemisphere, which happens when Mars is closest to the Sun. The seasons on Mars, like Earth, are a result of the planet’s axial tilt. In this image, the Argyre Basin, one of Mars’ deepest craters, filled with atmospheric haze, appears at the bottom left in a pale pink hue. At the top left, we see the deep canyons of Valles Marineris filled with tan-colored clouds. The white southern polar ice cap is visible at the bottom, retreating under the warmth of summer. This southern summer warming, combined with dust storms, pushes water vapor to high altitudes, contributing to the increased hydrogen loss from Mars observed by MAVEN.

ATLANTA — Five cases of malaria have been confirmed in Florida and Texas, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said Monday. It is the first time the potentially fatal, mosquito-borne disease has been acquired in the United States in 20 years. Four cases in Florida and one case in Texas were diagnosed over the last two months. The cases were identified in Sarasota County, Florida, and Cameron County, Texas. All five people were treated and are recovering.

Scientists from Japan’s Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (OIST) and the University of Washington studied the brain activity and skin patterning of octopuses (Octopus laqueus) during their active sleep phase. They found that these patterns “closely resemble” the neural activity and skin behavior exhibited when the creatures are awake. Similar wake-like activity occurs during mammals’ REM sleep, the stage when most dreams happen.

When both audiences and critics start talking about a movie, it can often get a boost in the box office. After analyzing reviews available on Rotten Tomatoes, researchers describe a “topic consistency” measure for capturing the amount of overlap between critic and user review content. According to study authors, this relationship does appear to impact movie sales. If critics and users generally discuss the same aspects of a given film in their reviews, it will be more memorable and increase the likelihood people will go see the movie. Similar reviews boost up so-so movies, interestingly, the findings suggest this association is stronger for movies with generally mediocre review ratings than it is for movies with extreme ratings fluctuations. It is also more robust when critics’ ratings echo those of users. For instance, when both mention aspects like the plot [twist] or the acting.

La représentation compte dans les films de Tyler Perry car elle permet aux spectateurs de tous horizons de se voir reflétés dans les personnages. Un sentiment de manque de représentation commence souvent dès l’enfance avec les livres. Plus d’un tiers des enfants ne se sentent pas représentés dans les livres qu’ils lisent, en raison de leur genre ou de leur origine ethnique. Un sondage réalisé auprès de 1 000 enfants américains âgés de 6 à 12 ans et de leurs parents révèle que près des trois quarts (74%) lisent régulièrement, mais conviennent que les personnages se ressemblent toujours et ne représentent pas différentes perspectives. De plus, seuls 13% des parents ont vu des personnes de minorités représentées dans les livres que leurs enfants lisent.

Utah’s Great Salt Lake, renowned for its high salt content, is facing an ecological crisis as its salinity reaches alarming levels. Droughts coupled with increased water consumption have led to record-low water levels, rendering the lake’s saline environment increasingly inhospitable for its resident brine shrimp. This, in turn, has grave implications for the migratory birds that depend on them for sustenance, as well as the local economy, which benefits from a multi-million-dollar brine shrimp industry.

Although few risks have been suggested so far, it is crucial to thoroughly evaluate the potential risks and benefits before considering taurine supplementation for improving human health and longevity.

levels and twice the risk of suffering heart problems such as blocked arteries, heart attacks, and stroke. Carbohydrates are one of the first sources the body uses for energy. Diets like the keto diet restrict the number of carbs you eat, forcing the body to break down fat for energy instead. The breakdown of fat in the liver creates ketones, chemicals the body uses as energy when there are no carbohydrates. People who advocate for a ketogenic diet often suggest limiting carbohydrates to 10 percent of your total calories. Instead, the focus is on getting 20 to 30 percent of protein and 60 to 80 percent of calories from fat. However, previous studies have linked a low-carb, high-fat diet to the highest LDL cholesterol levels. Doctors consider LDL the “bad” type of cholesterol that increases the risk of heart disease from atherosclerosis, a buildup of cholesterol in the coronary arteries.

The Jupiter-like gas giant defies all logic, somehow escaping engulfment by its host star. The planet, called 8 Ursae Minoris b, orbits a decaying sun known as K-type star — which is slightly cooler than our Sun and orange in color. As these stars balloon outward, anything too close is swallowed up. However, 8 Ursae Minoris b has survived.

Few things hold as much significance as the pursuit of professional fulfillment. It is a profound quest, for within the realm of meaningful work lies the key to unlocking our highest potential. A job that ignites our passion and resonates with our core values transcends the confines of mere labor, becoming a vessel through which we channel our talents and aspirations. When we find ourselves immersed in a role that nurtures our growth and allows us to express our authentic selves, we become architects of our own destiny. Our days no longer blend into a monotonous blur, but rather, they emerge as vibrant strokes on the canvas of existence. The importance of being fulfilled in a job lies not just in the happiness it brings, but also in the profound impact it has on our overall well-being and sense of purpose.

données sur les 20 000 espaces verts publics de Londres, ce qui leur a permis d’explorer les effets de la proximité avec la verdure sur le bien-être. Et les résultats ? Dans l’ensemble, ils ont constaté une relation forte entre la quantité de verdure près du domicile d’une personne et sa santé mentale, et les espaces verts situés dans un rayon de 300 mètres – environ 0,18 mile – du domicile d’un individu ont eu le plus grand impact. Par exemple, une augmentation d’un peu moins de 2,5 acres de verdure dans un rayon de 300 mètres du domicile d’une personne était associée à une augmentation de huit points de pourcentage de la satisfaction de vie, de sept points de pourcentage de l’estime de soi et de cinq points de pourcentage du bonheur. Maintenant, vous pouvez envisager d’acheter une maison dans les bois plutôt que de simplement partir en camping.

The study investigated whether there is a correlation between perceived breed pain sensitivity and actual pain thresholds in dogs. Researchers examined 149 adult healthy dogs from 10 different breeds that had been subjectively rated by veterinarians as having high, average, or low pain sensitivity. Pain sensitivity was measured using methods adapted from human clinical medicine, involving pressure and temperature tests applied to the dogs’ back paws. Emotional reactivity tests were also conducted to assess the dogs’ response to unfamiliar objects and people.

Those extra steps can make a major difference for your dog’s health, but also for your own. It turns out taking more steps per day can help you live longer. Moreover, researchers say it doesn’t matter if you take them all at once or in short spurts, just getting those steps in can lower the risk of premature death. The study, involving more than 16,000 women over the age of 60, also suggests that 4,500 steps per day is enough to help extend the human lifespan. In comparison to taking no steps at all, researchers find each additional 1,000 steps contributes to a 28 percent decrease in death among study participants.

MUNICH — Lager, the world’s most popular beer, originated more than 400 years ago in Bavaria due to a brewing accident, according to recent study. Researchers say the yeast used for brewing cold beer, known as Saccharomyces Pastorianus, emerged at the court of Maximilian the Great in Munich. This was the result of an accidental encounter and subsequent mating of two distinct yeast strains. The hybrid yeast is notable for its slower fermentation rate at cooler temperatures, such as those found in caves and cellars.

coffee lovers another reason to wake up and sip a cup or two, but research reveals that drinking two to three cups of coffee each day could add years to your life. Researchers found that drinking this beloved morning beverage lowers the risk of heart disease and dangerous heart rhythms. Exciting stuff, right? The study reveals this benefit applies to both healthy individuals and those with cardiovascular disease. In the biggest analysis of its kind, scientists tracked more than 400,000 people from the United Kingdom for at least a decade. And what exactly did they find? “Daily coffee intake shouldn’t be discouraged, but rather included as a part of a healthy diet for people with and without heart disease,” says senior author Professor Peter Kistler of the Baker Heart Institute in Melbourne, Australia, in a media release. So, cheers to waking up and sipping your way to a healthier heart.

OCD is a chronic disorder characterized by uncontrollable, recurring thoughts, known as obsessions, and repetitive behaviors or compulsions. Severe cases can significantly disrupt work performance, relationships, and possibly lead to social isolation. In extreme instances, these behaviors can even provoke suicidal thoughts.

Whether you drink espresso at all may come down to your genes. According to Professor Elina Hyppönen, the Director of UniSA’s Australian Centre for Precision Health, people have different reactions to coffee based on their genetic makeup and blood pressure. She explains that individuals who consume a lot of coffee are likely genetically tolerant to caffeine and can self-regulate their intake. On the other hand, those who don’t drink coffee or prefer decaf may have adverse reactions to caffeine and may be at risk for high blood pressure. This suggests that our bodies have a natural mechanism to protect us by guiding our coffee consumption based on our genetic predispositions and blood pressure levels.

bien connu que tous les comptes et utilisateurs sur les médias sociaux ne sont pas réellement des personnes. Certains sont des “bots” programmés pour transmettre et promouvoir un point de vue politique particulier, tandis que d’autres inondent simplement le web de publicités. De manière intéressante, toutefois, des chercheurs de l’Université d’Édimbourg ont découvert que les célébrités sont en réalité de plus grands coupables que les bots lorsqu’il s’agit de propager des désinformations et des discours préjudiciables sur les plateformes sociales. Les scientifiques rapportent que les commentaires et les messages publiés par les bots sur des sujets sensibles ont beaucoup moins d’influence sur les opinions réelles des lecteurs humains que les commentaires publiés par des célébrités sur les mêmes sujets. Plus précisément, les auteurs de l’étude affirment que les tweets partagés par des personnes ayant plus de 10 000 abonnés semblent avoir la plus grande influence sur les opinions du public.

The long hours it takes to extract sperm can play a role in successfully identifying viable samples as embryologists might experience mental and physical fatigue. Embryologists need to shred tissue samples and tease them apart with fine needles. Any sperm available is then placed into a special liquid in a petri dish. Using a microscope, the clinician searches through droplets of the liquid to examine the sperm. However, contamination from other particles and cells can make it possible for an embryologist to miss a sperm. Additionally, the longer the process takes, the greater the chance the sperm is no longer usable.

Los animales de apoyo emocional (ESA, por sus siglas en inglés) no se consideran animales de servicio (como, por ejemplo, perros guía para personas ciegas) según la Ley de Estadounidenses con Discapacidades (ADA, por sus siglas en inglés) debido a que carecen de un entrenamiento especial. Sin embargo, pueden hacer cosas maravillosas por las personas que luchan con condiciones como ansiedad, trastorno de estrés postraumático o autismo, por nombrar algunas. Si bien no es raro encontrar pavos como animales de apoyo emocional, los perros son los ideales para ESA porque son cariñosos, adaptables y entrenables. Como perros con una función específica, un perro ESA debe ser amigable, afectuoso y altamente inteligente. No todas las razas cumplen con los requisitos para ser un ESA. Por supuesto, todos los perros aman a sus dueños, pero algunos son demasiado independientes, nerviosos o tercos para brindar cariño cuando se necesita o ayudar a su dueño a relacionarse con nuevas personas. Not many health experts will argue that breakfast remains the most important meal of the day, for several reasons. And, according to a recent study, eating breakfast before 8:30 a.m. can help lower your risk for diabetes. The study by Northwestern University researchers shows that people who have eaten before 8.30 a.m. had lower blood sugar levels and less insulin resistance. The findings suggest that eating before 8:30 a.m. helps combat your risk for diabetes regardless of the time of day you stop eating. It’s a good thing that fast-food restaurants start serving breakfast as early as 5 a.m., but for health purposes, take it easy on fast food.

In the United States, St. Patrick’s Day is often used as an excuse to chug green beer and don tacky “Kiss Me, I’m Irish” merch. But in Dublin, the holiday is a more restrained and family-friendly celebration of Ireland and its patron saint—except maybe in the crowded Temple Bar district, which temporarily resembles Bourbon Street in New Orleans. Ireland is home to one of the oldest pubs in the world. Historic Seán’s Bar has been around since 900 AD. According to Irish Central, “those stepping inside Seán’s feel like they’re stepping back in time as the walls are graced with the photos of all the other visitors who have stepped over the threshold in centuries past.”

TORONTO — You’ve probably heard the lifestyle and health recommendations from various government agencies and health services time and time again. Exercise regularly. Eat a clean, green diet. Don’t spend too much time scrolling on screens. Be sure to get at least seven to nine hours of sleep daily. Keeping up with all of the recommended lifestyle choices for cultivating a long, healthy, and happy life can feel overwhelming at times. After all, adult life isn’t just about fitness and well-being. So, perhaps it shouldn’t come as all that much of surprise that a new, long-term research project by a team from York University reports that, when it comes to overall health, pretty much everyone has at least one area or two they can improve upon.

NEW YORK — If you’re going to a New Year’s Eve party this year, make sure you leave within an hour after the ball drops. A new survey focusing on 2,000 adults’ plans for the special night finds that the appropriate time to leave — according to 52 percent of respondents — is within an hour after midnight.

This groundbreaking research has the potential to clear the path for innovative, non-invasive treatments using the gut microbiome to combat cognitive decline in the aging population.

la noche que debería haber sido un logro destacado en la carrera cinematográfica de Will Smith, quedó empañada por su desafortunada reacción ante una broma que salió mal. La bofetada de Will Smith al comediante Chris Rock en los Oscars de 2022 quedará tristemente en la historia como uno de los momentos más inolvidables en la historia de los Premios de la Academia. Después de que Rock se burlara de la esposa del actor, Jada Pinkett Smith, quien sufre de alopecia, la impactante respuesta de Smith arruinó lo que de otra manera hubiera sido quizás la cúspide de su destacada carrera. Los fanáticos y las celebridades han sido bastante vocales sobre el incidente, y muchos han tomado partido en la disputa entre estos dos pesos pesados de Hollywood. Ahora, una nueva encuesta muestra que dos de cada tres estadounidenses creen que Smith debería enfrentar cargos por su reacción, admitidamente violenta.

If 150 minutes or 7,000 steps sounds like a lot, don’t fret: You may get away with less — if you’re old enough. Researchers from Northwestern University’s School of Medicine found that just an hour of brisk walking each week — about 9 minutes per day — can already help curb disabilities related to arthritis, achy joints, or stiff muscles among older individuals. “This is less than 10 minutes a day for people to maintain their independence. It’s very doable,” said study lead author Dorothy Dunlop, professor of preventive medicine. Doable indeed. Just make sure that it’s enough exercise for your pup as well!

Hairstyle trends are always evolving. As it turns out, many of us chose to experiment with new looks during the pandemic. A recent survey reveals 65 percent of American women underwent a “hair transformation” during their isolation. Whether it’s the need for a change (28%), the opportunity to try something new without judgment (21%), or just an attempt to tame some “out of control” locks (16%), women were using their time indoors to experiment and perfect their post-quarantine look.

Les problèmes de peau peuvent souvent nous rendre moins confiants dans les situations sociales. En fait, un récent sondage auprès de 1 000 Millennials et 1 000 membres de la génération X note qu’ils ont manqué des événements de la vie tels que des fêtes d’anniversaire (37 %), des dîners familiaux (36 %), des rencontres avec des amis (36 %), des fêtes au bureau (36 %) et des mariages (36 %) en raison de problèmes de peau. De plus, les soucis de peau ont incité les gens à éviter les restaurants (50 %), les bureaux (49 %), les magasins (47 %) et même à consulter un médecin (40 %).

NEW YORK — DNA is capable of imitating the function of proteins, folding into unique shapes to complete certain tasks. A new study finds that when DNA folds into three-dimensional structures, the molecules can take on the role of a protein called green fluorescent protein (GFP). The findings provide a whole new look at the versatility of DNA and its role in human functioning.

En los años 90, hubo una explosión creativa de sitcoms de televisión que se hicieron famosas, tuvieron un significado cultural en Estados Unidos y ofrecieron una amplia gama de representación para una gran parte de la población estadounidense. Las sitcoms afroamericanas de los años 90 se centraban principalmente en las relaciones cotidianas entre los talentosos miembros del elenco que dieron vida a estas historias. Al analizar nuestras fuentes, pudimos determinar las cinco mejores sitcoms afroamericanas de los años 90 que dejaron una marca en esa década.

La representación es importante en cualquier aspecto de la vida, como se observa en un estudio encargado por la marca de libros personalizados Wonderbly y realizado por OnePoll. El estudio revela que el 61 por ciento de las personas encuestadas afirmaron que la falta de representación en términos de raza y género les ha llevado a perder interés en la lectura de libros por completo. Más de un tercio de los niños no se sienten representados en los libros que leen debido a su género o etnia. La encuesta realizada a 1,000 niños estadounidenses de entre seis y doce años y a sus padres revela que casi tres cuartas partes (74%) leen regularmente, pero coinciden en que los personajes siempre se ven iguales y no representan diferentes perspectivas.

Si eres parte de la “Nación Bachelor”, entonces sabes que los concursantes en el programa hacen cosas locas para destacar en el primer encuentro. Pero los investigadores de la Universidad de California-Davis descubrieron que las primeras impresiones son muy importantes en el mundo de las citas. Su estudio revela que las primeras impresiones de compatibilidad y popularidad son muy influyentes en la elección de las personas a las que perseguimos como posibles parejas románticas. Si bien tanto la popularidad como la compatibilidad, en general, han sido estudiadas en muchos proyectos de investigación romántica anteriores, este estudio es uno de los primeros en su tipo porque tiene en cuenta cómo las primeras impresiones afectan los resultados románticos posteriores. En general, los investigadores descubrieron que las primeras impresiones tienden a perdurar y influir en si las personas desean tener más contacto con un posible compañero romántico después del primer encuentro.

Los Chihuahuas vienen en una variedad de colores, incluyendo muchos tonos más claros que son mejores para el calor. Sin embargo, algunos tienen hocicos cortos que podrían dificultar la respiración necesaria para refrescarse. “Si deseas un perro pequeño que sea encantador sin límites y que no sude en temperaturas altas, considera un Chihuahua. Sus orejas erectas, pelaje único y pedigrí geográfico descubierto por los estadounidenses que visitaron México a mediados del siglo XIX le ayudan a sobrellevar el calor”, explica Jo Myers, veterinario de JustAnswer, según informa Daily Paws.

¿Amas la comida italiana, pero te sientes culpable cuando te das un gusto? No temas, según los investigadores. Un nuevo estudio realizado por Nutritional Strategies Inc., que recopiló datos de decenas de miles de niños y adultos estadounidenses a través de la Encuesta Nacional de Examen de Salud y Nutrición del gobierno, ha encontrado que los consumidores de pasta tienen una mejor ingesta de nutrientes que aquellos que no comen pasta. Esto es especialmente cierto en lo que respecta a nutrientes en los que las personas suelen tener deficiencia, como hierro, ácido fólico, magnesio y fibra.

Though most festivals are centered around music, many attendees also go for the sense of community that being surrounded by like minded people brings. A study conducted by researchers from Yale University reports festival goers who attend mass gatherings such as Burning Man find themselves “transformed” by their experiences. People who felt transformed by the gathering reported feeling more connected to humanity and were more likely to help strangers. Festivals are often a great way to embark on a journey of self-expression and freedom while being surrounded by the arts.

On the other hand, many people (including 30% of the U.S. population) have chosen to adopt gluten-free diets in the mistaken belief that gluten is unhealthy or dangerous. Doing so also removes the healthy whole grains that can actually reduce the risk of developing cardiovascular health problems. The study involved gathering data from 64,714 females and 45,303 males working in the healthcare industry who had no history of heart disease. Researchers tracked their food habits and coronary heart disease rates every four years over the course of more than 25 years. Researchers looked specifically for a relationship between gluten consumption and an increase in coronary heart disease. After taking into account other risk factors, the authors concluded there was no meaningful correlation between eating foods with gluten and developing coronary heart disease. This applied to both male and female participants.

Due to word-of-mouth reviews and reactions, spoilers are everywhere. Knowing plot elements ahead of time can ruin the experience and surprise for some viewers, but for others, spoilers are just a way of finding out if a film is worth seeing. Most in the film industry have believed for decades that spoilers are bad for business. If everyone knows what happens, why would anyone pay to see it? That certainly makes sense in theory, but researchers find today’s fast-paced, impatient culture has a high tolerance for spoilers. Modern consumers are happy to read the spoilers and will still pay to see the genuine product.

The process of selection is a bit more nuanced than it might seem at first. It’s a moment full of terror, panic, and hunger — which snack do you pick? So how do the most indecisive of people finally make a selection when facing dozens of choices? A new study finds human decision making is less about picking favorites and more about sheer eye contact. Researchers from the United States and Germany say the amount of time people spend looking at a certain object helps them ultimately decide whether or not to pick it. Their experiment reveals consumers choose snacks they spend more time looking at, even over choices they rate as more appealing.
